characters: MOVE THROUGH A SERIES OF SHOTS
CRYING INFANT COME UP ON THE TRACK
SPRAY OF WATER FROM A LARGE FOUNTAIN
IN THE RACKS OF THE SCAFFOLDING
AT THE DOOR TO THE MANIACS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a moving wall of muscled skin, tinged blue by moonlight. Four claw-like scratches are raked across this landscape bright red.  Throaty, guttural MOANS drift up from somewh Are we in heaven?  Or hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A delicate hand caressing a muscled bishop. A woman's leg entwined around a man's. A cascade of red hair falling across an unshaven cheek. Two faces pressed tightly together in a kiss. The faces belong to ALICE and DAN, and as their moans bui to a crescendo we realize it isn't pain we're hearing but opposite.  Afterwards...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE'S HANDS
dialogues.text: gently rove Dan's back, tenderly caressing the scratches  they've just made.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: her relaxed, happy face gazes up from the pillow.  She tu and smiles at Dan. Dan sleepily smiles back, then gently reaches out to care her shoulder.  Their eyes hold for a moment.  Alice leans over and kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to take a shower. Dan nods and closes his eyes, still smiling.  Alice climb from bed.  FOLLOW HER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water pours down into the drain from the shower.  TIGHT o Alice's HEAD AND SHOULDERS as she steps INTO FRAME and st under the cascading water.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SHOWER
dialogues.text: The hot water streams down onto Alice's face.  She scrubs herself clean.  The water beats down on her shoulders and back.  She rinses her hair.  Shakes her wet head.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRAIN
dialogues.text: gives an odd gurgle, like something had backed up the  plumbing.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: glances down.  Nothing.  Turns back the jets of water.  T pressure builds up a little.  She turns it down.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRAIN
dialogues.text: the gurgles again.  The water starts to back up, rising  around Alice's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She notices.  Leans down, perturbed, as the water reaches ankles and tries to clear the drain.  No success.  The wa continues to back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh great.  The drain monster strikes  again.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: stands back up now, a little apprehensive.  As the water  rises to her knees, the pressure from the shower jet sudd DOUBLES!  Gallons of water now BLAST into the shower.  Al tries to turn it off but the handles come off in her hand She tries to open the shower door.  IT WON'T BUDGE!  She' trapped and now the water is climbing to her neck!  Frant Alice POUNDS on the glass!

dialogues.speaker: THE SHOWER
dialogues.text: Completely full.  Alice stands inside, completely under  water, slamming her fists against the door, in desperatio Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the door opens.  But it is no longer Alice's glass shower door.  It's one of the heavy doors in the asylum.  As it  opens toward CAMERA, Alice stumbles out of the STATIC WAL WATER into a dark room.  The door closes behind her and m into the wall. Alice looks around.  She is in a dark empty corridor.  Tw doors flank both ends of the hallway.  One opens. Alice tries to peer beyond it.  Darkness.  Slowly, she ge to her feet and steps through it...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER DOOR
dialogues.text: further on, opens, beckoning her forward.  And another do beyond that.  And another.  Cautiously, Alice moves down corridor of invitations until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she steps through the last door.  Shadows and light pl across her face.  She looks around.  What she sees sends into her eyes.  This is where Amanda Krueger was raped. asylum.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: slowly down the length of this nightmarish room.  Fingers lights stab up from crusting floor grates and reach throu the thick, murky air toward a dark cathedral ceiling, who beams appear to be made from the bones of some unearthly  creature.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA CONTINUES BACK
dialogues.text: revealing beds and mattresses crowded along the walls.  O Filthy.  Some torn to pieces.  We can make out the figure men lying in them.  And others milling around.  These are AMANDA'S HUNDRED MANIACS.  All dressed in the garb of 194 mental patients.  Some pace aimlessly.  Devoid of sanity purpose.  Others sit, lost in their own private hells.  N one has noticed Alice.  Yet.  At the end of the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: revealing a staircase that leads to a huge IRON DOOR.  Tw ORDERLIES hover on the landing before it, gazing into the scene below.  One of them pokes his finger into the dark, silently counting.  The other is eager to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, will ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, you'll make me lose count...  eighty-two, eighty-three...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: looks down at herself.  Now she is dressed in an old  fashioned nurse's uniform.  White and starched.  There is name tag over her left breast.  It reads: AMANDA KRUEGER. Alice barely has time to react when she hears the first  orderly impatiently say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close enough.  Let's call it a hundred  and call it a day. We hear the SOUND of RUSTY HINGES as the heavy door start swing closed.  Alice looks up.  Starts moving toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...WAIT!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DOOR
dialogues.text: As it slams closed with a resounding CLANG.  We hear the  SOUND of heavy bolts being thrown in place.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: whirls around.  WHIP PAN with her as she discovers that t door she came through is no longer there. She turns back to the room, frightened.  Starts moving fo the bolted steel door at the far end.  As she hurries  forward, the maniacs notice her.  All heads turn.  Horrib faces peer at her from everywhere.  Some of the men move  toward the center of the room, blocking her way. Alice stops.  There is no way past them to the door.  She turns.  The maniacs move in on her from all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy's hundred fathers.  A drooling, macabre parade of  human beings.  Hands grope toward her.  Hideous faces lee

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: watches, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is looking less like an insane asylum in the 1940's more like a nightmare scene of London's 16th century Bedl The maniacs converge on her.  One pushes his way through others.  (we recognize him as Robert Englund, sans Freddy make-up.)  As he reaches toward her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as CAMERA begins to descend, pushing in, moving closer, t maniacs surround her.  As they begin to drag her down, Al turns her face up toward CAMERA.  PUSH IN EXTREMELY CLOSE she SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice lunges up from bed INTO FRAME.  SCREAMING.  Dan  immediately sits up beside her, concerned.  A hand rests her shoulder, between them.  Alice realizes where she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA TRACKS AROUND
dialogues.text: until Alice's profile blocks Dan's face.  The following l begins OFF SCREEN, during the CAMERA TRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter hon?  Bad dream? Suddenly ENGLUND's leering face pushes into FOREGROUND FR beside Alice.  It's his hand on her shoulder and we reali that he spoke the line, not Dan.  She turns, startled, th SCREAMS. Englund rolls on top of her, pinning her to the mattress.

dialogues.speaker: ENGLUND
dialogues.text: grinning down at her, his tongue snaking out his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no such thing as safe sex.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: pushes him away with every ounce of her strength.  She st to sit up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice sits up, terrified!  Looks around in panic.  Realiz she's alone in bed.  Where's Dan?  She reflexively glance toward her open bedroom window.  Its curtain gently billo with the morning breeze.  Dan has gone home. Alice tries to collect herself.  The dream is over.  But can tell by her face that she is far from all right.  She pulls on a robe and shakily climbs from bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice moves toward the shower.  Pauses before it.  Takes breath and opens the door.  Looks inside.  Normal enough. Turns on the water.  Watches apprehensively as it pours  serenely down the drain.  She'd really rather not, but Al reluctantly starts to remove her robe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we stand naked and defenseless before  an ever more unimaginable horror

dialogues.speaker: SPRAY OF WATER FROM A LARGE FOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN from the water to a statue in the fountain's cen And from the statue down to Dan, dressed in a graduation and gown.  He's perched on the statue's pedestal, his arm draped irreverently across the stone man's shoulder, grin as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...college.  High school was only the  beginning for some of us.  Don't forget:   S.A.T. stands for Sadistic, Anti-human,  Torture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter from a sea of fellow graduates who are gathered  round the base of the fountain, outnumbered by their less amused parents.  Beyond them, we glimpse even more caps a gowns milling with roving bands of adults. DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of us have just this one summer to  live... and by live I mean...paaarty! The kids sends up a cheer as Dan throws his cap into the and leaps off the fountain.  He floats DOWN through a sea ASCENDING caps, disappearing into the crown of students.

dialogues.speaker: TO GRETA AND HER MOTHER
dialogues.text: standing at the edge of the group.  Greta is living proof what God can create when he's having a good day.  She's  beautiful.  and fashion model-thin.  Her only flaw might the hint of neuroses in her perfection. Her mother, RACINE GIBSON, a once beautiful woman now  expanding into middle age, raises a disapproving eyebrow  toward Dan and the boisterous kids around them. RACINE GIBSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How colorful.  Who is he? GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan Jordan.  Captain of our football  team. RACINE GIBSON (with distaste)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charming...

dialogues.speaker: GRETA
dialogues.text: a head TALLER than everyone around her as she suddenly  squeals with delight, recognizing... GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice!  Yvonne! Through the swirling crowd we see Alice standing with YVO a very grounded black girl.  Her father stands with them. Alice is a little glum, but Yvonne breaks into a wide gri they both turn toward Greta. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, girl! Yvonne gives Alice a little tug and they hurry toward Gre

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE GIRLS
dialogues.text: Yvonne and Greta throw their arms around one another and up shrill noises of girlish delight.  Then Yvonne breaks the girls RAP. YVONNE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the Y, the V-O-N-N-E, and wherever I  am, that's the place to be. ALL THREE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yvonne! Alice isn't getting into the spirit of things.  Yvonne tr to inject a little enthusiasm into her. YVONNE (to Alice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, honey! Alice joins in, trying to be cheerful. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the A-L-I-C-E.  Blond hair on my  head, blue eyes to see. ALL THREE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greta! GREAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The G-R-E-T-A and my mom says I'll be in  magazines one day! ALL THREE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the three together, and together  we'll be.  The Y, the A, don't forget the

dialogues.speaker: G
dialogues.text: The all three put their hands together in an overhead SLA Greta and Yvonne break into laughter.  Alice halfheartedl joins them, about a step behind their good spirits. YVONNE (to Alice, good naturedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's wrong with you -- let's see a  smile. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had kind of a long night. YVONNE (grins knowingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan keeping you up again?  Put a lock on  that window, girl. ALICE (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the Dan part was nice... Greta playfully tugs at her gown, interrupting them. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things are wild... (striking pose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes you look like a nun-- ALICE (trying to cheer up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah - kick the habit!  Break those vows! They laugh.  Greta feigns hormonal desperation. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find me a man! MARK, good-looking, though considerably off-the-wall, STE INTO SHOT holding a SMALL SKETCHPAD and a LARGE, EXCESSIV LOLLIPOP.  He speaks to her as though he were a fashion  photographer. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's all wrong.  Sell it!  More teeth  and raise the arms a bit. Greta drops the pose and addresses the heavens. GRETA (sarcastically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should spell it for you. ALICE (playfully)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe God's trying to tell you something. Mark smiles at Greta, as he puts away his sketchbook.   They're old friends and this is a familiar game. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, when are you gonna come to your  senses?  GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next life.  Oh, what's that? MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My undying love.  Have some. Yvonne and Alice laugh. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up, Mark, it's hopeless. MARK (with a grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm starting to wear her down. (to Greta)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have some anyway. GRETA (aghast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must never pass these lips. RACINE GIBSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greta, that's not what a cover girl puts  in her body. Past her shoulder, Greta indicates Mrs. Gibson, glaring  disapprovingly.  Mark gets conspiratorial. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me later.  Milkshakes.  Cherry pie.   Banana splits.  And no mom! GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pimples, heartburn, cellulite... and no  modeling career. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention the heartbreak of  psoriasis. ALL LAUGH. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greta, come on.  One burger with me? GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One with you and I'm off to comic book  land.  We're high school graduates now.   Time to grow up. Dismisses his sketchbook. GRETA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And speaking of grown-ups... Daddy's  here, superhero. All turn as Mark's father, MR. GREY, approaches.  Mr. Gre steps into shot.  A rugged, blue collar type, he glances the girls then at Mark.  His hearty cheerfulness contains note of reproach. MR. GREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Rembrandt!.  No wonder I couldn't  find you.  I thought you'd be hanging out  with the guys. Mark becomes uncomfortable in this big man's presence. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Dad.  I thought the guys could  hang out with themselves. They offer up a trio of hellos.  Alice turns to Mark. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring your sketchbook to the  ceremony.  I'd love to see what you did  to D.W. MR. GREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.W. Yates. The Principal. He looks to Mark, who goes sheepish, then fesses up. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Dickweed, sir. Mark's dad isn't too amused. MR. GREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh... I hope you had time to finish  those cross-sections I asked for. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get into that later, Dad? There is an awkward beat as everyone falls quiet. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you again, Mr. Grey. (begs off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go find Dan. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, before they revoke his diploma. As Alice turns away, the cheerful face she put on dissolv and we see that underneath she's still on the edge. FOLLOW ALICE through the crowd.  Suddenly, a DARK SHAPE l up behind her, lifting her in a bear hug. Alice jumps,  startled.  As the big arms twirl her around she comes fac face with Dan.  He smiles. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, beautiful. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!  Don't do that! DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, babe. He sets her down, his feelings hurt.  Alice recovers. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.  Give me a kiss. He plants one on her lips.  Then... DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a present for you. He reaches into a pocket beneath his gown.  Grins as he h her two AIRPLANE TICKETS tied with a ribbon.  She tries t enthusiastic, but doesn't come off. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tickets. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coach seats, but the plane lands  in Paris.  It's gonna be a helluva  summer, hon! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Dan's well-acquainted with Alice's moods.  He turns to he with a lover's required patience. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, babe.  What's the matter? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing...it's just...I didn't see my  father at the ceremony. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll show up.  C'mon, what's really  wrong? Alice hesitates. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had one of those dreams last night. Dan's face grows concerned. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About him? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Well, not exactly...it's that...I  felt like I wasn't in control.  For the  first time since...all that.  I'm scared. Dan gives her a reassuring hug. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stopped it didn't you?  It was  probably just a regular bad dream.   ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I guess. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't dream him up, he can't hurt  you.  Or me.  Or us.  Remember... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Suddenly, MR. JORDAN, Dan's robust middle-aged father,  approaches through the crowd, excited. MR. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan, this is Coach Ostrow... Dan's father drags a gruff-looking, crew-cutted man INTO  SHOT.  Dan's mother brings up the rear. MR. JORDAN (cont'd) (conspiratorially to Dan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's interviewing this week. (to coach)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach, you're looking at the stat's  finest quarterback.  You know what they  say = this boy feels the need for speed. OSTROW

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I've hear. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, summer's just starting -- Mr. Jordan starts to lead Dan away. MR. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking about your future. Mrs. Jordan shoots a less than friendly look at Alice. MRS. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse us, dear. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Dan Dan and his parents move away with the coach.  Alice star after them as they disappear into the crowd.  Turns away.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: A wall of people moves away and Alice finds herself among Yvonne, Greta and Mark again.  Mark is answering Greta. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That club sucks, they card everybody.   Let's just party at your place. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my mother -- get real.  What  about Alice's? Alice shakes her head. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad's got this thing about drinking in  the house. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we gotta do something! Yvonne shares an amused look with Alice, then steps in ta control. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right kids, I tell you what we're  gonna do.  I've got swimming practice  until six-thirty today... GRETA (trying to follow)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means they're gonna give me the key  to the pool so I can lock up when I'm  done. Mark's face lights up.  He goes off like a joy bomb. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pool party!  I dig it!  Babes in wet T- shirts.  No -- topless!  Fucking heaven! The three girls look at each other, annoyed.  Then break in mischievous grins. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Y, the A... GRETA & YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget the G! On cue, the girls all give Mark a SHOVE!  He falls back, flailing, and lands on his ass in the middle of the fount Everyone nearby LAUGHS.  Mark looks up at the girls,  innocent. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I say? The girls help pull a chagrined Mark from the fountain.   Suddenly, Alice frowns, remembering something. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, damn!  I have to work tonight. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Dan to bring you after. (to Mark)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, let's get you mopped up. MR. GREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark!  Picture time.  Come get  immortalized.  Parents and brats. All groan. RACINE GIBSON (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greta!  Photo opportunity, dear! GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.  They caught me, too.  Guess I'd  better go gnash my thousand-dollar teeth  for the paparazzi. Alice glances at her watch.  Looks around for someone.  C find him.  She looks a little more unhappy.  As Mark, Gre and Yvonne prepare to go... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: you guys go ahead. I'll catch up with you  later.

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE TREES
dialogues.text: Alice trudges along, staring at the ground, unhappy. ALICE (cont'd) (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Alice.  You looked  beautiful up there.  I'm so proud of  you...gee, thanks Dad. VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do look beautiful. Alice looks up, surprised.  Her father stands before her, near a tree.  She smiles.  Her father tentatively smiles  back; a gruff man, uncomfortable with emotional displays. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid you weren't coming. ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched from behind the stands.  Didn't  want to embarrass you, ya know.  "The  drunk showed up", that kind of thing... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's in the past.  Unless you've  stopped going to the meetings. ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  A deal's a deal. He produces a wrapped present from behind his back.   Hesitates, awkward, then hands it at her.  Alice's face  lights up as she stares at the package. ALICE'S DAD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, go on.  Open it. She gleefully rips the paper off and opens the box.  It's camera.  She smiles, delighted and surprised. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad! ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the model you've been saving up for.   I wanted you to have it for your trip. Alice stares lovingly at him. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a damn what they might  think.  You're terrific. She gives him a kiss on the cheek.  He tries to take it i stride.  She ponders him a second longer.  Then takes his and begins to lead him toward the foundation. ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To take a picture.

dialogues.speaker: PARENTS AND KIDS
dialogues.text: lining up for a group photo.  Alice and her father ENTER  SHOT.  Alice hands her camera to someone just OFF SCREEN. see them all taking places, changing their minds, moving to someone else.  Mark's father puts a big arm around Gre mother.  Beams, unaware of the horror and distaste that j leapt onto Racine's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parents and off spring are moving toward their cars.  CAM PANS across the crowd to...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE AND DAN
dialogues.text: hugging.  Her father stands a few feet away. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me when your shift ends. Alice nods.  Dan shakes her father's hand. DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, sir.  I'll have her home by  August. Alice's father frowns. DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just kidding. Dan smiles at Alice and heads off.  Alice hands her gown flowers to her father as he opens the car door. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for everything, Dad. ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want a ride to work? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just across the park. He climbs into the car.  Smiles his gruff smile. ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, angel.  Have fun tonight. Alice waves goodbye as he starts the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice walks down an empty street.  Perhaps too empty to b right.  There is a faint SING-SONG NOISE, but it's not ye discernible as anything.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: gives a faint look of ominous recognition.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Alice passes the entrance to the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groups of kids are playing on the swings, in the sandbox, the slide.  The SING-SONG continues.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: sees something.

dialogues.speaker: PAST THE OTHER CHILDREN
dialogues.text: The ELM STREET CHILDREN play their ominous rope games... SING-SONG becomes identifiable now.  It's the Elm Street  Children's Anthem... "three four, better shut the door...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Her face hardens with resolve. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  This isn't going to happen. She closes her eyes tight.  Then opens them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse now.  All the normal children are gone.  Only the E Street Kids remain...playing their endless games.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: grows more determined.  Heads into the park.  CAMERA STAY WITH HER  as she moves with increasing speed.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELM STREET CHILDREN
dialogues.text: always managing to somehow stay one turn ahead of her.

dialogues.speaker: THE PARK
dialogues.text: itself has taken on a foreboding darkness.  The trees cas oddly elongated shadows.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: has left the path.  She moves rapidly now through branche that tear at her clothing and her face.  Soon she is runn blindly in the direction of the ever present VOICES.  She breaks through some bushes and finds herself in a...

dialogues.speaker: CLEARING
dialogues.text: An open green in the center of the park.  She is all alon and the effect, even to the color of the grass at her fee is dreamlike.  The VOICES have ceased.

dialogues.speaker: IN A 360 PAN
dialogues.text: There is nothing but the green common with the trees and  brush all around it... But from somewhere nearby, she hears the chanting VOICES  they've added a new couplet. VOICES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine ten, Freddy's back again...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA CONTINUES IN A SECOND 360
dialogues.text: And now, where there was foliage a moment ago we see a se GOTHIC STEPS, framing a SILHOUETTED NUN.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: stares with intrigue as the children's voices fade.

dialogues.speaker: THE STEPS
dialogues.text: past stone GARGOYLES in the FOREGROUND.  The nun hurries the steps toward CAMERA, her face obscured by her habit's veil.  As the nun moves PAST CAMERA we see Alice, at the  bottom of the steps, hurrying after her. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: ASYLUM DOORS
dialogues.text: at the top of the steps as the nun moves inside.

dialogues.speaker: STEPS
dialogues.text: Alice runs up, INTO SHOT.  Stops.  Glances up at somethin high above her.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ASYLUM TOWER
dialogues.text: rising toward the sky.  Immense and imposing.  Three wind set in a row at the very top, are it's only features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely deserted.  Alice moves slowly down a seemingly endless corridor.  She passes a deserted reception area, an empty nurses station.  Open doors lead into frightenin pits of darkness all along the hallway. INTERCUT Alice's pensive watchful face with the shadowy  ominous world through which she is walking.  We just know that something really nasty is going to happen.  As she  passes an open doorway, she hears a strange, animal SOUND form the room within.  She pauses, looks inside, then rec with shock as she sees a sheep, it's mouth all bloody,  standing with it's lamb, near the carcass of a large, dea snake.  Suddenly she hears the sound of rusty wheels and  whirls around to see:

dialogues.speaker: A FREDDYESQUE BABY STROLLER
dialogues.text: black, ominous looking, rusting, rolls slowly down the  corridor toward Alice from behind.  As it moves toward  CAMERA, PAN WITH IT TO...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: as she backs against the wall watching the evil pram roll past.  Then Alice notices something beyond it, far down t corridor.  CAMERA follows her gaze to...

dialogues.speaker: THE NUN
dialogues.text: hurrying SOUNDLESSLY through a doorway.  We only catch a  glimpse of her as she disappears from view.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: reacts.  Runs past the stroller towards the nun. THE WHITE OF A NUN'S HABIT SWIRLS OUT OF CAMERA to reveal staircase. SHOOTING FROM OVERHEAD as Alice moves INTO FRAME and star up the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving up.  There is a SQUEAKY ECHO OF WHEELS OFF-SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALICE FROM BELOW
dialogues.text: as she turns to look down.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: as she looks back up the stairs.  She takes one step forw and...

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: She's yanked down OUT OF FRAME!

dialogues.speaker: A SET OF DOUBLE DOORS
dialogues.text: BANGS open.  Alice lies on a gurney, her head tilted back face the CAMERA mounted behind her head.  The gurney race down a corridor, pushed by a dirty, unshaven, orderly.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: She is pushed through another set of doors into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE HABITED NURSES, AIDES, and DOCTORS all crowd around peer down at her.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: looks around, horrified and confused.

dialogues.speaker: A DOCTOR
dialogues.text: leans down toward her. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to be afraid of.  Just do  exactly what I say.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: sits bolt upright on the gurney. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd of spectators...orderlies, nurses and doctors, all backed away and now crowd the walls of the room.  STO ALICE AMONG THEM AND TRACK INTO CLOSE UP.  (Alice is stil hospital gown.)

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (IN THE SPECTATORS)
dialogues.text: Her eyes lock with...

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA KRUEGER'S
dialogues.text: who is now the one on the gurney, about to give birth. AMANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me...why is this happening again?  Please!  Don't let him do this... A painful contraction wracks her body.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: tries to understand the meaning of her words.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: is now lost in the agony of Freddy's birth. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't panic, sister.  We've got a breach  birth here.  It's backwards. I'm going to  have to turn it around.  Okay.   Deep breath.  Here we go.  I need you to  push...now!  Push! The birth proceeds. DOCTOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit!!  What is it?!

dialogues.speaker: A NUN
dialogues.text: stands, holding something in swaddling (which obscures th thing from her view.  She addresses her answer to Amanda. NUN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is still one of God's creatures, you  know.  Take solace in that.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: struggles upright on the operating table.  She is drenche sweat and clearly terrified.  She stares directly into th eyes of the nun holding the swaddled bundle. AMANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is no creature of God!

dialogues.speaker: THE NUN
dialogues.text: gazes at Amanda, shocked by her words.  She starts to spe Suddenly, the swaddled bundle begins to kick and beat  furiously.  The nun fights to keep hold of it, but the bu struggles free from her grasp and falls under the gurney. a second, it scuttles into the shadows. We hear a horrible BRAYING SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: THE ORDERLIES
dialogues.text: involuntarily step back, staring at the thing on the floo Then general panic sets in. AMANDA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!  Give it to me! A few orderlies scramble to close the doors.  Some bolt  through them, racing to get away from the thing on the fl Bedlam reigns as people shout and rush around.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: watches, transfixed.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: streaking towards Alice.  He scuttled between her legs an out through the double doors. AMANDA (0.S. cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let it get away!

dialogues.speaker: THE DOUBLE DOORS
dialogues.text: swing closed.  PAN to Alice, as she gets back to her feet turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The delivery room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: turns back to the doors.  She moves slowly and deliberate

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORS
dialogues.text: CAMERA moves toward them.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: scared but determined.  She stops in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORS
dialogues.text: HOLD LONG ENOUGH so that we're dead sure something evil i going to jump right into Alice's face.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: takes a deep breath and reaches out to open the doors! Nothing awful grabs her.  Her expression changes to one o horrified recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Freddy "died" in Nightmare Four.  That horrible BRA SOUND comes from somewhere nearby.  TRACK WITH HER as she starts into the church.  CRANE UP OVER HER to reveal the  church in all its horrid glory, full of Freddyized church artifacts.  There is no sign of the "baby."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moving past row after row of pews.  There are SLIMY, GULP NOISES now, SOUNDS even more unspeakably unpleasant that thing's BRAYING.   The SOUNDS echo in a way that tells Alice nothing about w they're coming from.  The thing could be anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: ain't to happy about that!

dialogues.speaker: NEAR THE ALTAR
dialogues.text: Freddy's fetid remains lie in a crumpled heap.  We recogn bits of striped sweater.  A claw catches a stray bit of l from somewhere.  In the distance, Alice moves slowly forw

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: stops for a moment...staring at the place she thought she left her nightmare forever. There is a SLITHERING SOUND from the steps leading to the altar!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: watches in horror.

dialogues.speaker: THE FETAL MONSTER
dialogues.text: now we see this "baby".  It's shape is vaguely human, but with the gleaming skin of a flayed goat.  It seems to gro it moves.  The thing slithers toward the decaying remains Freddy's signature outfit.  All the while, its shape is  becoming more loathsomely human...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Her eyes widen as she realizes what is about to happen. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't make me bring you BACK!

dialogues.speaker: THE THING
dialogues.text: begins to crawl in through on of Freddy's pants legs.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: runs toward the altar. There is an EAR-SPLITTING NOISE OF WOOD BEING RIPPED AWAY

dialogues.speaker: THE ALTAR
dialogues.text: rise from the floor.  The floorboards begin to tilt up to Alice as they are torn from their foundation. The angle of the rising floor throws Alice back.  She loo at the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It continues to rise, preventing her from reaching it.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: can only desperately, impotently try to crawl "uphill"  through the dust and smoke towards the impending  resurrection, powerless to prevent it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice's struggle to reach Freddy before he is "resurrecte with... SPLINTERING WOOD; SHATTERING GLASS; the RISING ALTAR. CLOSE SHOTS of bits and pieces of Freddy's metamorphosis through the growing dust of the crumbling church, as that embryonic thing GROWS...into clothes...into the glove...i the body.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: struggles, but there is no way she can even reach the alt and God knows what she could do even if she did get there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Freddy's mid-section, stretching fully into shape.  An then, suddenly... The floor falls back into its level position with a dust  raising THUD.  Alice hits the ground.  HARD. SILENCE.  And dust.  Then.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: raises herself up off the floor.  Looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing but dust and smoke, back-lit by light streaming i through the broken stained glass windows.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: in BACKGROUND, through the smoke as...in EXTREME FOREGROU CLOSE-UP, the charred remains of a hand, reconstructing  itself, reaches down and slips into the glove.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALICE
dialogues.text: as she hears the GHASTLY SCRAPING SOUND of Freddy's claws

dialogues.speaker: THE ALTAR
dialogues.text: Nothing but the settling dust...and somewhere behind it, figure silhouetted in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY EMERGES
dialogues.text: standing in front of the pulpit with his arms raised in a ultimate mockery of the resurrection. He looks even a little more grotesque than usual.  Missha like the Crooked Man.  His arms and legs aren't quite the same length.  The joints are twisted so that nothing in h body seems aligned.  Nevertheless, he smiles at Alice, an his smile's more malevolent then ever. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a boy.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: backs away from him, frightened...and angry.  Freddy's no a very good mood, either.  The two circle each other, kee their distance. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't come back!  I locked the door  on you! Freddy laughs, a dry rasping cackle.  Takes a step closer her.  Terrified, Alice reflexively strikes out.  But Fred vanishes.  His chilling laugh echoes around the church wa Alice follows that laughter with her frightened eyes,  searching for him.  Suddenly... Freddy appears right behind her.  He slips his arm around waist and caresses her tummy with his clawed hand. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I found the key! Alice almost jumps out of her skin.  She spins around to Freddy throw his head back and CACKLE...then a shaft of l comes through the rear doors of the church.  Freddy turns toward it.  His laughter abruptly dies.  Alice faces the doors too.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA KRUEGER
dialogues.text: in her nun's habit, gazes at them from a room beyond the  doors.  She is RIMLIT, caught in the light streaming from THREE WINDOWS behind her.  She points an accusing finger Freddy.  (Amanda speaks in the austere voice of a young  woman, though it is the same actress playing Amanda  throughout.) AMANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your birth was a curse on humanity.  But  the more evil that was in me is no more.   I will not allow this to happen again.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: makes a sound of PURE HATRED as he glares at his mother. He's almost beside himself with rage as...

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: turns to Alice. AMANDA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring him home.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: starts to move towards Amanda.  Picks up her pace as she  goes. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home?  How?  Where?

dialogues.speaker: ON AMANDA AND ALICE
dialogues.text: as Alice now RUNS toward her. AMANDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rid yourself of... But just as Alice is about to reach the doors, they SLAM  CLOSED in her face. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Alice struggles to get the big doors open.  When she does she hurries through only to find herself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...walking through the diner's front door.  (She's back i her street clothes.)  The place is empty.  Too empty.  We certain that Alice is still in her nightmare.  She looks  around.  Puzzled.  Completely freaked out.  She feels the counter and furniture, checking out the "reality" of the  place. VOICE (O.S.) (near shout)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice!  Where've you been? Alice damn near jumps out of her skin.  Spins around!  It ANNE, a classmate and co-worker of Alice's.  She's pretty pissed off.  Relieved, Alice starts to break down.  She's obviously disturbed and frightened. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne!  Oh god, I'm glad it's you.  It was  terrible. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hours late. She throws her apron at Alice.  WHIP PAN with the apron t Alice.  She's genuinely stunned. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours?  Last thing I remember was  crossing the park... She looks at the clock.  It's after midnight.  Anne angri gathers her things. ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party'll be history by the time I get  there... Great! Alice just stands there, stunned.  Anne shakes her head a moves toward the door. ANNE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could get a prescription for  whatever you're on. ALICE (not hearing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what? ANNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said thanks a lot, Alice.  For nada! The door slams as Anne goes out.  Alice reaches for the  telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A raucous pool party in full swing.  People are splashing around in the water.  Some dive from pool's edge to  cannonball their friends.  Laughter. Chatter.  And the bl of loud ROCK MUSIC fills the air.  Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: A GIRL'S BLOODCURDLING SCREAM
dialogues.text: rises above the cacophony.  People scatter to get the hel out of the way as...

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: leaping off the high-dive, plunges like a graceful comet  toward the water's surface.  Strikes the water where ever else used to be. She comes to the surface and swims to the pool's edge ami applause from the others.  As she climbs from the water,  FOLLOW HER through the swirling crowd of partying teens t

dialogues.speaker: DAN AND MARK
dialogues.text: Dan sleepily lies in a lounge chair.  An unopened bottle champagne, decked with a ribbon, rests beside him.  Mark busy sketching in his book -- a "big hunk" with his arms  around two "babes".  He takes a sip of beer. Greta sits next to them in a gorgeous bikini.  She reache into an ice chest and hands Dan a beer.  GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did your dad say about you and  Alice going to Europe? Dan passes the beer to Mark, who lines it up next to the he's already got.   DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much.  He mostly screamed.  Thinks  I'm throwing my life away. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's throwing their life away? Yvonne towels off herself as she tries to catch up on the conversation. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan.  And he's taking Alice with him --  pretty good dive Yvonne.  You've been  practicing. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hours a day, six days a week. Greta offers a beer to Yvonne. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have another one, sounds like you need  it. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naah, I'm done.  Got to be on shift in a  couple hours. (gesturing to pool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going in? GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  It's getting too cold for me, and  my wonderful mother will kill me if I  screw up my hair.  She's got some model  agency guy coming to dinner tomorrow  night. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever get tired of your mom  trying to run your life? The others turn toward him.  Mark and Greta know just wha Dan means.  Yvonne shrugs, matter of factly. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let 'em. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, no problem. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right.  Sometimes I feel like I'm  living with Melicertes. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he was this ancient guy I read about  who like, killed his kids 'cause they  didn't want to run the kingdom the way he  thought they should. Greta stares at him, blown away. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're weird, you know that? There is a beat, as all ponder this in silence.  Then Mar breaks their reverie.  Grabs Dan's champagne. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw 'em.  Open the champagne.  Let's  have a party. Dan grabs the bottle away. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands off squirrel.  That's for me and  Alice...for later. Behind them we hear the SOUND of a glass breaking O.S.,  followed by a loud OUCH!  They turn toward the sound.

dialogues.speaker: POOL'S EDGE
dialogues.text: One of their classmates clutches his foot in pain, then p a piece of broken glass out.  BLOOD pours out of the woun

dialogues.speaker: MARK, DAN, GRETA AND YVONNE
dialogues.text: Everyone cringes.  But Mark really reacts.  He turns PALE Closing his eyes tight. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man!  I could've gone all night  without looking at that. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this... All that gore you  paint in the comics and you're squeamish? DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little blood, guy. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red ink I can handle by the bucket load.   The real stuff makes me... you know. YVONNE (joking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vomit? MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faint. Dan shakes his head at Mark's sensitivity.  He closes his eyes and leans back on the lounge chair as a JOCK approac the group.  Greta pats Mark on the shoulder. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can look now, it's safe. Mark opens his eyes as the Jock leans toward them. JOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Dan.  Telephone. Dan nods.  Sets the bottle down and begins to head away. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right back -- and don't mess with  the bottle. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll guard it with our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice talks on the telephone - trying to remain calm. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was him. (she pauses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was awake when it happened.  Do you  understand what I'm saying?  He must have  dreamt himself up...Jesus, Dan...I'm  scared. She listens.  Seems to feel a little relief. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will...just hurry, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark sits next to Greta, showing her his sketchbook.  Yvo is stretched out in Dan's lounge chair.  Dan hurriedly  approaches and yanks his jacket from the back of the chai pulling Yvonne up a couple inches. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody die? DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  I just gotta go. Mark turns to Greta with a knowing grin. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice beckons. Dan starts to hurry away.  Mark calls to him. MARK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Romeo.  You forgot the secret  ingredient. Dan stops.  Mark hefts the champagne.  Dan grabs it, almo in afterthought and rushes away. MARK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he goes, the fast man on three  legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan's truck speeds along a deserted stretch of road.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: Dan is at the wheel.  He looks intense, worried about Ali He's also very tired.  The VOICE of an abrasive TALK RADI fills the cab.  We listen to him while Dan fights to keep eyes open. D.J. (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, lady...and Elvis killed Marilyn  'cause the Kennedy's put fluoride in his  water.  WHAT'S THE MATTER, LADY...DID YOU

dialogues.speaker: GO OFF YOUR MEDICATION
dialogues.text: He hangs up on her.  PUSH IN CLOSER and CLOSER on Dan as conversation continues. D.J. (O.S. cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...is there anyone out there with a  functioning brain that wants to talk to  me? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Line two...you're on the air. Dan's eyes close for a second.  There is an eerie BUZZ an STATIC from the radio. MRS. JORDAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling about my wayward ex-son  Daniel, who has just acted like on  ungrateful, unmanageable Dickweed, ever  since he was seduced by this bimbo, slut- whore, Alice... Dan's eyes open and he stares in shock at the radio which transformed itself into a rusting antique. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...? Then another voice comes to him through the radio. FREDDY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I were you lady, I'd kill the  ungrateful piggy!

dialogues.speaker: THE RADIO
dialogues.text: changes from "talk show" to a BLARINGLY LOUD HEAVY METAL  STATION.  Les's brilliant speed metal masterpiece "Fast T To Hell" fills the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: stares down at the radio.  His confusion has given way to fear.

dialogues.speaker: THE SEAT BELTS
dialogues.text: snake out to impossible length, wrapping around his arms. Dan manages to keep his right hand free, but the belts wi around the rest of his body, pinning his left arm useless to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: crosses over onto the center divider, out of control.

dialogues.speaker: GAS AND BRAKE PEDALS
dialogues.text: Dan tries to hit the brakes.  But as his foot comes off t accelerator, the BRAKE PEDAL snakes around and slams down top of his foot, pushing the accelerator to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: winces in pain.  Wrenches his left arm free of the belts grabs the wheel.  Desperately reaches with his right for GEAR SHIFT, which ducks away from his groping hand like a darting cobra.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: lurches across the center divider and charges into the  oncoming traffic!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: hunts wildly for the elusive gear shift. Hears a LOUD POP from inside the cab.  He looks over...

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: is now sitting in the passenger seat, clutching Dan's bot of champagne.  His side of the truck is now "Freddyized". takes a huge gulp of champagne.  Then...spits it out.  It hits the dash, SIZZLING like ACID.  More of it runs down arm and shoulder.  It's smoking, too.  He turns to Dan. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad year.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: some of the drops hit him, burning his chest and arms.  D

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: His striped jersey begins to smoke as the shoulder socket melts away.  Freddy grins.  Turns to Dan. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better buckle up.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: as he reaches with his left arm and RIPS his right arm of Then he welds the smoking socket onto the doorjam above t corner of the passenger window... and pulls his on his CL His arm STRETCHES like an extending seatbelt.  He hooks h claw into a "Freddy buckle" at his waist.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: has been watching all this in horror.  Suddenly...he hear loud HONK.  WHIP PAN with Dan to his POV through the  windshield as the BRIGHT LIGHTS of an approaching truck W OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: as he looks down at the gear shift lever.

dialogues.speaker: HIS HAND
dialogues.text: slamming the lever into REVERSE.

dialogues.speaker: DAN'S TRUCK TIRE
dialogues.text: skidding on the pavement.  Burning rubber.  Starting to m as the brakes lock!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: is slammed headfirst through the windshield.  Shattering  glass EXPLODES all around him, as Dan flies over the hood

dialogues.speaker: CEMENT AT POOL'S EDGE
dialogues.text: Dan slams down INTO SHOT, bouncing on the hard ground.  H lounge chair tumbles after him.  Dan's entire body is  lacerated with small cuts, his hair is singed and what's of his clothes are tattered, smoking shreds. He manages to untangle himself from the overturned chair get to his feet.  Somewhere a telephone is RINGING.  That what must have awakened him in time to save his life. Dan looks around, dazed.  The pool is empty.  The party h broken up.  Dan turns toward the ringing phone. Behind him is a glassed in cubicle/office.  The ringing p sits on a desk inside.  Dan tries the door.  Locked.  The suddenly comes to his senses in recognition. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice!.... Dan turns, and charges toward the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAN'S TRUCK in the FOREGROUND.  Beside it sits a gleaming MOTORCYCLE.  Dan comes running INTO SHOT, searching himse for his keys.  Can't find them. He tries to open the truck's door.  Locked.  He slams the hand against it in frustration.  Then notices the Yamaha  1200. Its key is snugly in the ignition slot, like an invitatio Dan hops on the bike.  Turns the key, and kick-starts the monster.  The engine jumps to life.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE PARKING LOT EXIT
dialogues.text: From across the lot we see Dan and bike charging toward u He roars PAST CAMERA and screeches onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan guns the bike's motor and races toward the Crave-Inn. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: THE ENGINE
dialogues.text: gives a terrific GROWL.  The bike's front end comes off t ground as the bike goes into a wheelie, then accelerates the street at an outrageous speed.

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: frantically dodges several cars, swerving into the oncomi lane to pass one, then careening back to avoid a pair of  looming headlights.  Dan looks down at the instrument pan

dialogues.speaker: PANEL
dialogues.text: All the gauges are RED LINED.

dialogues.speaker: DAN'S FACE
dialogues.text: begins to distort with the G-FORCE of this impossible rid The bike just keeps increasing speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: goes out of control.  The gauges swing erratically.  They begin to speed up dizzyingly, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its cover flies away in shards revealing a frenzied  collection of MOVING WIRES and BLINKING LIGHTS beneath. The wires and lights begin to ungulate in an evolution of patterns.  Soon we realize a FACE is beginning to form ou this tangled, sparking mess.

dialogues.speaker: THE BIKE
dialogues.text: is moving so fast now the other cares are only passing bl Dan slaloms through them at an impossible rate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: continues to metamorphasize.  Wires spark and leap as the wind in and around each other.  Lights at the top move to the center to form two eyes. Shards of sparking metal marshal themselves into two rows electric teeth. Other wires form cheekbones, lips, and the sickeningly  recognizable scar patterns of Freddy's skin. And that's just what we're looking at...

dialogues.speaker: CYBERNETIC FREDDY
dialogues.text: His electric eyes stare up at Dan's frightened face with glee of anticipation.  He speaks with Mr. Jordan's voice. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to feel the need for speed,  Dickweed!

dialogues.speaker: DAN
dialogues.text: stares down at the face in horror.  Then he sees somethin really bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: his right hand clutches the handlebar/throttle.  Cables f out from the brake and throttle grip and PLUNGE INTO HIS with a smoking SIZZLE, attaching him to the machinery.  H skin begins to undulate and BUBBLE UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Dan's left hand.  Cables have melded with his bubbling flesh there, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: across the side of the bike, where the gas tank is starti to transform into a hideous living creature/machine.   Distended ribs protrude.  The gas tank/torso begins to  undulate as it breathes...

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA CONTINUES DOWN
dialogues.text: toward the cylinders, which stretch and begin to breathe, then comes to rest between them and the whirring spokes o the front wheel.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and we see Dan from below the handlebars.  Through the  tatters of his shredded clothes we see more cracking,  bubbling skin.  His face is wracked with torture and  something beyond even horror.  Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: THE HANDLEBARS
dialogues.text: now joined completely to Dan's hands, THRUST DOWNWARD,  slamming his chest to the body of the bike.  Dan stares i Freddy's robotic face, now an inch from his own.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA TRACKS
dialogues.text: from left to right, passing beneath the breathing cylinde The highway blurs below us.  The CAMERA emerges on the le side of the bike, looking back toward Dan's left leg.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXHAUST PIPE
dialogues.text: is merging with Dan's leg.  Growing into it, as Dan's ski continues to bubble, and billow up, then peel off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and now we realize that Dan has become a MACHINE/MAN, lik butterfly emerging from its cocoon.

dialogues.speaker: DAN'S FACE
dialogues.text: Only his eyes remain human.  Dan struggles, continuing to meld with the machine.  He opens his mouth, forcing the  metallic skin to crack around the edges, and begins A LON HIDEOUS SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA RAPIDLY PULLS BACK
dialogues.text: to reveal a FULL SHOT of the FREDDY BIKE hurtling down th street that has become nothing more than an abstract blur movement and light.  Dan's SCREAM continues to build, for into a plea of terror... DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN on Freddy's leering grin. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't dream and drive!

dialogues.speaker: DAN'S EYES
dialogues.text: looking down at Freddy. A bright light washes over Dan's eyes; We hear an  EARSPLITTING DIESEL HORN!  Dan looks up INTO CAMERA.  Squ against the light.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE DAN'S TRUCK
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE DIESEL SEMI TRUCK hurtles toward CAMERA like a  juggernaut. PULL BACK to reveal that the POV is now from inside Dan's truck, staring out the windshield at the twin beams of an

dialogues.speaker: APPROACHING SEMI
dialogues.text: CAMERA TILTS DOWN to Dan's unattended steering wheel...

dialogues.speaker: FAST TRACK
dialogues.text: through the windshield, IN SLOW MOTION.  Dan frantically  tries to return his now human hands to the wheel...too la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the semi's BRIGHT CHROME RADIATOR FILLS THE SCREEN!

dialogues.speaker: A HOT GRILL
dialogues.text: as a HAMBURGER PATTY is dropped into it.  The meat begins SIZZLE.  A RADIO plays.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: she is pouring a late night CUSTOMER a cup of coffee.   Suddenly...the restaurant SOUNDS distort.  She hears Dan' VOICE calling her name.  Alice snaps to as the coffee cup she's filling overflows.  She drops the pot of coffee.  T entire wall behind her changes to

dialogues.speaker: SCREAMING HER NAME
dialogues.text: Alice turns.  Runs toward the wall. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan... DAN'S HIDEOUS FACE PULLS AWAY as his DISTORTED, GROTESQUE BODY goes flying backwards down a long MEMBRANOUS TUNNEL from Alice. He disappears into the depths just as Alice reaches the w She stretches out her hand...and the wall returns to real

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: is wracked with a SPASM and PAIN!  She clutches her stoma and doubles over, as though she'd been kicked.  She fight the pain away.  Then gets up and runs wildly to the stree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice charges out of the diner.  Behind her, far down the street, we can make out the silhouette of a JACK-KNIFED S back-lit by the flames and smoke of DAN'S BURNING TRUCK! hear the BLARE of a jammed horn. A SERIES OF JUMPCUTS BETWEEN Alice's face and her POV END CLOSE ON HER FACE as she SCREAMS. CAMERA TURNS WITH HER and FOLLOWS HER as she runs panicke toward it.  The BLARING horn grows LOUDER. As she nears the semi, the driver's door swings violently open!  A figure LURCHES from the cab.  Grabs her as she m past.  The momentum swings them both around.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: his bloody face is lit by the burning wreck of Dan's truc His eyes are glazed and shocked.  He SCREAMS madly into  Alice's face. TRUCK DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came flying out of nowhere!  Like he  was a fucking rocket!  I didn't even see  him... We hear a WALL of approaching SIRENS.  Alice's tear-stain face is strobed in a flashing red light as she looks past semi driver to see Dan's mangled body enmeshed in the  wreckage.  As she tries to get to him his eyes snap open he looks straight at her. DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was him! Blood wells from his gaping wounds as he chokes and dies. Her eyes begin to lose focus.  In a moment...Alice collap falling OUT OF FRAME...leaving only the black of the nigh sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK.  Then... Alice's rim-lit profile moves into frame. Track around to reveal Yvonne working in the background. Continue tracking to reveal that we're in an unlit hospit room.  What little light there is comes from the glass  observation window in the background. Through the window we can see Alice's father conferring w a DOCTOR, Dan's parents and TWO POLICE OFFICERS.  Beyond we see traffic in the corridor.  Alice's eyes open sudden ALICE (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was him. Yvonne hears her and comes over, leaning into frame. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alright...It's okay, honey.  I'm  right here. Alice stares at Yvonne.  Things are far from alright. YVONNE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, Dan's been in an accident... Alice shakes her head. ALICE (in a monotone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was no accident.  It was Krueger.  He  used to get in through my dreams, but not  anymore.  He's found some other way. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, it's no dream.  I'm sorry...Dan's  dead. Alice stares at her as her eyes fill with tears as she  remembers.  As she starts crying she clutches Yvonne in a desperate embrace.  At the sound of her crying, Dr. Moore her father leave Dan's parents and approach Yvonne and Al ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, honey... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, he's coming back...Krueger's  coming back.  Make them understand. YVONNE (looking at Dr. Moore  nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down.  Take it easy.  You're hitting  shock. ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice.  The police found fragments of a  champagne bottle... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan didn't drink.  You know that.  It was  probably for me - to celebrate our trip. Her father looks away, helpless.  Dr. Moore turns to him speaks in a confidential, professionally calm voice. DR. MOORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These sorts of outbursts aren't entirely  uncommon.  Many women have them in the  first few weeks.  Especially if they've  suffered a traumatic shock. (to Alice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But don't worry young lady, you're going  to be fine. ALICE (getting increasingly  hysterical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't be fine and neither will any of  my friends.  We've got to do something.   Dan's already dead...Don't you see?  He's  back and he's just getting started. (as she remembers what Moore  just said)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  What's he talking  about?  What's wrong with me? Yvonne speaks up, trying to be comforting. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. She and Alice hold eyes for a beat.  Everyone is silent. YVONNE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just a little pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Stunned.  She lies back, closing her eyes tightly.  A tea forms at the edge of one and spills down her cheek. ALICE'S DAD (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor wants to keep you here  overnight... DR. MOORE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for routine observation.  To make  sure you're as comfortable as possible. Alice hasn't been listening.  We hold on her troubled fac she opens her eyes again, the full ramifications sinking ALICE (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan's baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice lies in bed, apparently asleep.  The camera pans sl around the room.  It is eerie in here now with the long  shadows of hospital equipment thrown across the walls by dimmed hallway lights. The camera continues slowly, deliberately to move around room until we are on the OPEN doorway.  STOP.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: a boy of about six or seven years stands there, watching  Alice.  He's frail.  Other worldly.  Not ghost-like, but  possessing a strange, transcendent quality. He wears a white hospital robe and stands without moving, just staring at Alice with a transfixed smile of happines Alice's gaze at the ceiling slowly moves toward the child though she were willed by some force to notice him. She's startled at first by his presence.  Then she realiz he's only a boy.  Even if he is a little odd. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...wake up. ALICE (tentative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? They gaze at one another for a beat.  They each seem to b transfixed by each other. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Jacob. She smiles.  She waits.  He just watches.  He stands ther the way that little kids have of feeling no need to fill silence with conversation. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't you be in your room, Jacob? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lonely in there, in my room. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is... He cuts her off with: JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry your boyfriend got killed. ALICE (shocked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know that? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could tell you were sad.  I just wanted  to see if you were all right. He smiles kind of shyly and turns.  Alice calls after him ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob.  Wait.  Don't go. But he has already disappeared down the dark corridor.  H ON Alice's troubled face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Yvonne walk out of the building. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you visited the little boy on my  floor?  Jacob, the one who looks kind of  sad? YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't any little boys on your  floor. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must've wandered up from the  children's ward.  I just wondered what  was wrong with him. Yvonne shakes her head. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a children's ward. Alice stops.  Puzzled. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he was wearing a hospital robe. Yvonne looks at Alice with a mixture of impatience and  compassion. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to tell you. Alice takes this in.  Thinks about it.  Yvonne looks a li more concerned about Alice's state of mind. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did everyone call everyone? YVONNE (hesitant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're waiting for us...but let's keep  this dream stuff between you and me.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: pacing and speaking animatedly.  CAMERA tracks with her. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda Krueger was a part of a religious  order that ran that asylum.  She was  raped and had the baby there in the  1940's.  That baby grew up to be Freddy  Krueger who murdered twenty or thirty  kids right here on Elm Street. Mark, sitting at Greta's feet.  He glances up from his  sketchbook, intrigued.  Track back with Alice to... ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He got caught but the courts cut him  loose on a technicality.   The parents of the murdered kids formed a  posse and killed him.  Torched him. Track to Greta.  Hold on her disbelieving face.  She ligh up a cigarette. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover girls couldn't smoke. She blows smoke in his face. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that was just the beginning.  He  keeps on killing...only now he kills  people in their dreams, their nightmares.   And he uses my dreams to get to his  victims.

dialogues.speaker: GRETA AND YVONNE
dialogues.text: exchanging dubious, concerned-for-Alice looks.  Mark seem incredulous.  Keeps on sketching. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to write some of this down. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why it's my fault Dan's dead. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop saying that, it's bullshit. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk about the baby. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, congratulations...I guess. Alice angrily cuts them off. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what we're here for! There is a beat, then... YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  Dan's parents were pushing him.   Pushing him hard.  He was bitching about  it at the party last night.  He was under  pressure.  We all are. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushy parents can make you more than a  bit crazy. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that got to do with it? YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Dan died you weren't even asleep.   You said so.  End of story. Alice glares at them, adamant. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Than he must have found another way. Greta looks down at Mark's drawing:  sees his comic book  sketch of the one-hundred maniacs. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Mark!  Mister compassion. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen!  This isn't a goddamn joke!  He  gets in through my dreams -- somehow.  I  thought I could control it, but  something's changed, and I don't know  what he'll do next. Everyone stares at her.  Not knowing what to say. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we all liked Dan. And we love  you... Great stands.  Puts her hands on Alice's shoulders. GRETA (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottom line, Alice.  Anybody,  supernatural or not, that wants to hurt  you - he'll have to go through us first. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of us.  Right? Greta nods in agreement. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm afraid of. Hold on Alice, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice removes a couple of frozen microwave dinners from t refrigerator and sets them on the counter.   While she does so, the CAMERA TRACKS around and as she le on the counter, we push in to reveal she is lost in thoug tears forming in her eyes. Her father comes in carrying a bag of groceries - healthy stuff: veggies, chicken, fruit, Rye Crisp, juices.  As he comes in, Alice covers up her tears and turns away to put dinners in the oven.  He obviously has something to say t her in mind and the two of them talk simultaneously. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was the meeting? ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sobering... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny. ALICE'S DAD (unpacking groceries)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice... ALICE (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when are you such a smart shopper? ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since my little girl became a mom... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disappointed in me? ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not.  I sort of hope it's a boy.   Be nice to have a boy playing in the  house again. Alice looks at him, then hugs him.  A beat.  Her father  gently pries her away.  Manages a little smile. ALICE'S DAD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't make a habit of it. Alice smiles back.  Reaches for the can opener. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.  Let's do salad.

dialogues.speaker: GRETA
dialogues.text: from behind, sitting on the edge of her bed.  All around propped up on pillows, and covering her dresser and chair are SEVERAL DOLLS.  Some of which are clearly wind-up wit keys in their backs.  Everything from Barbies to European porcelain.  Her mother's shrill voice comes from down the hall as we hear her try to open Greta's locked bedroom do MRS. GIBSON (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greta... CAMERA SLOWLY TRACKS until we are facing Greta and we see that she is holding one of the delicate china dolls in he hands.  She stares at it, lost in thought.  Her eyes move something at her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An 8X10 blow-up of the snapshot taken on graduation day l on the floor.  In the center is Dan, surrounded by his  parents and friends.

dialogues.speaker: GRETA
dialogues.text: contemplates the picture.  Her eyes well up.  A tear begi slow track down her cheek. MRS. GIBSON (O.S. cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our guests are waiting, dear.   Appearances, you know, let's not make  them impatient. GRETA (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash 'em your boobs.  The sight of all  that plastic ought to stun 'em for a  while. (then calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming Mother! Greta pulls herself together.  Wipes her eyes.  Sets up t china doll on the bedstand next to the photo.  Gets up.

dialogues.speaker: CHINA DOLL
dialogues.text: in FOREGROUND as Greta moves to her bedroom door in  BACKGROUND and EXITS.  As the door closes, the precarious perched doll teeters then gently tumbles out of shot.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE YEARBOOK
dialogues.text: As the doll floats INTO SHOT, falling towards the photogr cracking apart on impact...

dialogues.speaker: HANDS
dialogues.text: opening a bottle of wine.  The cork comes out with a muff pop and the hand begins to pour. MRS. GIBSON (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true, people are always mistaking us  for sisters.

dialogues.speaker: RACINE GIBSON
dialogues.text: sits at the head of a massive table, hosting one of her  expensively catered dinner parties.  Though she doesn't l in the least like Greta's sister, the other guests nod an titter politely. The house is decorated in "modern pretentiousness" and th guests match the spirit of the room.  Greta sits at the  opposite end of the table from her mother, wearing a  beautiful white dress. One of the guests turns from Greta to her mother. GUEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greta certainly has the perfect body for  modeling.  You know, Eileen Ford's a  friend of mine. (to Greta)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her about you.  She's very  interested Greta doesn't respond.  Her mother's delighted. MRS. GIBSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greta, you're being offered the chance of  a lifetime!  I think you should show a  little gratitude. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of my friends died yesterday, mother.   DO you mind if I take a few hours off to  remember him? MRS. GIBSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're having a party, dear. She glares at her mother.  A half-drunk TRENDY GUEST spea TRENDY GUEST
