dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read about him.  Drunk or something,  wasn't he? Mrs. Gibson cuts her off, trying to damage-control Greta' association with someone her guests might disapprove of. MRS. GIBSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just a friend of Greta's, not  someone special, not someone she was  seeing, you understand.  Really just an  acquaintance... Another guest speaks up, a THIRTYSOMETHING TYPE. THIRTYSOMETHING GUEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sad.  It reminds me of Fitzgerald.   Although in his stories, it's general the  women who have pointless, violent deaths. Greta tires to ignore him.  The other guests jump in with their own literary allusions and comparisons.  Greta CLOS HER EYES to shut them out.  For a second she seems to nod Catches herself.  Looks up as... FREDERICK, the caterer, steps forward and offers her  selections from a tray of food.  We don't see his face, b sliver of a GREEN AND RED STRIPED JERSEY peaks out from a his starched tuxedo collar.  Greta shakes her head no. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you.  I'm not hungry. Frederick steps away.  The other guests strangely cease  conversing mid-sentence and turn to her.  Greta's mother  notices with alarm.  Faces her daughter. MRS. GIBSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you eating? GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't really feel up to it. The other guests begin to eat voraciously. MRS. GIBSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, dear.  You ought to try  something. GRETA (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who's always slapping my  hand about weight-watching. Her mother glances nervously at the other guests.  Her vo takes on a shrill edge. MRS. GIBSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's why we diet, dear.  So we can  eat at social events and not upset the  other guests.

dialogues.speaker: FREDERICK INTRUDES
dialogues.text: FREDERICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam, if I may... He wheels in a trolley with a sterling silver chafing dis it.  He turns to Greta and pushes in the tray to the hide baby chair, which Greta's chair has become, pinning her i place. The guests continue chowing down, while Mom beams  approvingly.  Greta stiffens into a parody of too-straigh posture. Frederick removes the lid of the sterling silver chafing with a flourish, revealing a perfect, miniature doll-like replica of Greta. With a flourish, he proceeds to slit it open, filleting i front of Greta's horrified eyes with one of the blades on Freddy's clawed hand. Frederick has now become Freddy, transforming from the no Robert Englund to Freddy Krueger. At the end of the blades on Freddy's claw, a sharpened si spoon now exists. He scoops into the dissected doll and begins to feed Gret forcing some of the mush into her mouth.  Greta resists,  turning her head to spit it out. Freddy jerks her head back to the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as her head is snapped back.  Another claw/spoonful of mu in her face. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are what you eat. The table guests laugh and feast on in the background. MRS. GIBSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing but the best for Greta! FREDDY (with another spoonful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second helping. The guests laugh as Greta struggles helplessly, moaning a groaning her objections. MRS. GIBSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk with your mouth full, dear.

dialogues.speaker: GRETA
dialogues.text: stares at the claws/scoop wide-eyed as they force the MUS into her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Freddy shoves another spoonful. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget dessert. GUEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rare delicacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to reveal what Freddy is feeding her.  He stands over Gre scooping his claws into her TORSO as though it were made ice cream, and delivering the stuff back up to her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: GRETA
dialogues.text: screams in horror as she realizes what she's eating.

dialogues.speaker: OVER ALICE'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: As she steps to the refrigerator and grasps the door hand we get a glimpse of something foreboding a split second  before she opens the door...a Freddy magnet above the han that says DIE BITCH. Alice pulls the door open.  PUSH IN past her to the groce inside.  a real Freddy food feast of graveyard leftovers flies swarm when Alice opens the door.  Maggots, rot and  cobwebs.  Dripping fetid garbage.  Then suddenly... Greta's hideously mutated face SHOOTS INTO CLOSE UP from  RIGHT FRAME!  Her cheeks have been horribly distended.  F spills from her mouth as she tries to scream.

dialogues.speaker: OVER GRETA'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: who we can now see is impossibly coming out in the open  refrigerator door.  Her arms desperately reach out toward Alice who stands frozen, FACING CAMERA, in open-mouthed  shock. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greta! Then Alice leaps into action.  She grabs Greta's hands an begins to pull with all her might.  But she can't get Gre out! ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK FAST
dialogues.text: away from the struggle, through the kitchen door, into th living room and further back still until Alice's father  appears in LEFT FOREGROUND, sitting in his easy chair,  reading the newspaper. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!  Help!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE REFRIGERATOR
dialogues.text: looking past the mounds of disgusting stuff to Alice and  Greta.  Suddenly, FREDDY'S CLAW comes INTO FOREGROUND SHO

dialogues.speaker: ALICE AND GRETA
dialogues.text: Alice has managed to pull Greta a couple inches further f the open door when Freddy LUNGES out of the refrigerator! With lightning speed he grabs Greta's arm and YANKS the d closed with a WHAM! ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: as she quickly yanks the fridge open again and  sees...Nothing!  Everything is back to normal.  No sign o Greta or Freddy.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: staring into the fridge with amazement and fear.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: closes the door and rushes to the telephone on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DREAM
dialogues.text: Freddy shoves another clawful of stuff into Greta's mouth She starts to CHOKE. Freddy pulls Greta to him.  Hugs her, patting her back, l a parent burping an infant.  He's almost cradling her as continues to choke the life out of herself. Freddy's "patting" becomes harder.  Greta jolts under eac slap on the back...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DINNER PARTY
dialogues.text: She starts to choke.  Her face goes blue.  She stands.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUESTS
dialogues.text: stare at her in shocked amazement.

dialogues.speaker: GRETA
dialogues.text: stands, arms out, leaning forward as though suspended, as Freddy were still "burping" her.  Then she pitches forwar face first into her plate.

dialogues.speaker: GRETA'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: looks down in shock at her obviously dead daughter. GRETA'S MOTHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greta?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big industrial shop.  Mark's father's business and thei home.  Rain falls on the cement drive, glistening in the  light that spills from beneath the big, half open deliver door.  Across the door we see: GREY & SON CONSTRUCTION. The "& SON" has been recently added.  Alice and Yvonne, s in her nurse's uniform, approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge warehouse and commercial shop.  Rows of scaffoldin filled with prefab door and wall units, recede into the  darkness.   A glass partitioned office fills a corner near the door. can see Mark's father moving around inside of it.  Alice Yvonne enter and move toward the office door.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICE DOOR
dialogues.text: Alice and Yvonne peer inside.  Mr. Grey, dressed in workm clothes, is stoically trying to repair a broken name-plat We can tell that one of the two desks in here was intende for Mark.  Alice looks around, concerned. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Grey...is Mark around? He looks up, very upset.  Nods.  Angrily gestures toward labyrinth of racks. MR. GREY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RACKS OF THE SCAFFOLDING
dialogues.text: The rays of a single worklight high on the back of the wa stab like fingers through the maze of scaffolding.   Silhouetted against them, Mark slowly glides between the  racks on a skateboard, a solitary and forlorn figure. Alice and Yvonne enter shot, backs to CAMERA, watching hi ALICE (tentatively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark, are you okay? MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I'm just aces. Looks like he's not.  Mark ignores them as Alice and Yvon move closer.  He's a tightly wound coil, ready to snap. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to both you guys about  Greta.  And... MARK (snapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very fucking sorry, but Greta is dead  today.  Could we interest you in someone  else? Alice steps closer to him, her empathy allowing her to ig his tone of voice. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just an accident.  Like with Dan. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No accident.  I tried to warn all of you  about Krueger. Yvonne shakes her head.  Not wishing Alice to indulge her fantasies. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Alice... But Alice's words have left an effect on Mark. He brings skateboard to a halt.  Gives her a direct look. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought about that. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She must've fallen asleep at the table... YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Alice.  Just stop it.  Stick to  the facts. Mark glances at her. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. He goes back to Alice. ALICE (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand what's happening.   Krueger has to use my dreams, but he got  to Dan and Greta while I was awake.   How's he doing it? YVONNE (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you two stick to reality. Mark turns his displaced anger on her full force. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you shut up and let her talk!   Two of us died in the last two days, does  that strike you as particularly normal?! YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark... MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not finished - I loved Greta.  A lot.   And if maybe, just maybe, someone or some  thing killed her, I'd like to hear about  it! YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't listen to this. She starts to turn away.  Mark gets angry again.  Shouts. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then get out! ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark! Hurt, Yvonne starts to get up.  Turns for the stairs.  Ma realizes he's being a jerk.  Punches his fist against the scaffolding in frustration.  Calms himself down. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aww,shit...Yvonne, wait a minute, will  ya. She stops.  Turns. MARK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an asshole.  I know I'm not dealing  with this very well and it's not your  fault.  I'm sorry. Yvonne gives him a little hug.  Tries to smile. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick around, please? Yvonne brushes Mark's hair from his face like a big siste YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wish I could, but I'm on night shift  again...gotta go. Mark nods.  Tries to smile.  Alice steps up to them.  Put comforting hand on Mark's shoulder. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can stay for awhile if you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A combination studio and storage space for the world's  largest collection of comics.  The entire loft is a netwo of scaffolding.  Shelves for his comics, fantasy posters, sci-fi memorabilia.  Stuffed in among them are tons of bo on mythology and the occult. MARK (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I'm an idiot...for being in  love with her? ALICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody thinks that. Tacked to the walls and scaffolding, are dozens of drawin Works in progress of Mark's super hero comic book creatio As the CAMERA pans across the sketches, we see the evolut of this character.  Several names have been tried and cro out as Mark's conception has continued to bloom. CONTINUE TO PAN until we come to a SIX FOOT POSTER of the character in final incarnation as...THE PHANTOM PROWLER. MARK (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I know I didn't stand a chance in  hell, but... PAN PAST THE PROWLER to Alice and Mark, sitting near his  drawing table.  She sits next to him, a comforting arm ar his shoulder. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cared a lot about you. Mark nods.  Thinks. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was her mother who killed her,  with all that Polly Perfect shit. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't her mother.  The only reason  we're still here is that none of us has  slept since the grad party. Mark looks at Alice.  Sees the certainty on her face. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me some more about this Krueger guy. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I go make some coffee.  There's  a lot to tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice is coming back into the room with two steaming mugs She looks around.  No Mark. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark?... She starts forward, looking around for him.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BED
dialogues.text: Mark has fallen asleep.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: Alice can't see him.  She approaches the drawing table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: approaching the table.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: sets the coffee down and sees something that stops her co

dialogues.speaker: THE TABLE
dialogues.text: The sketch of Greta begins to move, reassembling itself i a drawing of the ELM STREET HOUSE.  Mark stands on the po opening the door...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: realizes what's happening.  Reaches her hand toward the p ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark!  No! But he goes inside. Alice quickly picks up one of Mark's colored felt tip pen and draws a stick figure of herself next to the Elm Stree house.  She writes "Alice" above the figure then throws d the pen and closes her eyes, concentrating. PUSH IN on Alice, eyes closed, using all her will... (The BACKGROUND distorts as Alice goes into the dream.)  PULL from Alice's face and now we see that we're

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice rushes inside.  Comes to a halt as she sees

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE, GAPING HOLE
dialogues.text: in the floor, with jagged "paper" edges, like something o of Mark's cartoons.  Mark desperately clings to one of th edges, which slowly begins to tear... Alice rushes over.  Through the hole, she sees what Mark about to drop into...the pulsating FETAL CANAL!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: as she kneels and stretches her hand toward Mark.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: He looks up at Alice, noticing her for the first time, an maybe not sure if she's really there.  He hesitates.  The paper tears some more.  He's about to fall! ALICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it! Terrified, retches a bloody hand toward Alice, straining reach her fingertips...

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING UP
dialogues.text: Mark's legs dangle above, slipping lower as the paper  continues to tear...

dialogues.speaker: MARK AND ALICE
dialogues.text: Alice gets down on her belly, trying to reach closer to M who keeps slowly slipping further into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR HANDS
dialogues.text: fingertips quivering a millimeter apart, then touching, t moving toward each other's palms until their hands firmly grip!

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING UP
dialogues.text: Alice begins to pull Mark up, away from CAMERA

dialogues.speaker: ALICE AND MARK
dialogues.text: As Alice struggles to pull Mark from the yawning mouth of canal, it begins to close around him, trying to suck him in.  With a final tug, Alice yanks Mark out, and the cana closes, leaving no trace on the now normal floor. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: As Alice races INTO SHOT toward the door.  Mark follows c behind.  As Alice flings the door open, Mark comes to a h BACK TO CAMERA, noticing something on his hands.  BLOOD. stares in horror... ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Mark!

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: hands raised before his face.  His eyes are opened in sho Then they start to unfocus as he begins to wobble.  In th next second he is FALLING OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice watches as Mark feints himself AWAKE.  As he's abou hit the floor, he dissolves away.  Alice starts to turn b to the door when something OUT OF FRAME catches her eye. CAMERA PANS TO RIGHT until we see... JACOB standing at a  window, staring forlornly into the street.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: freezes.  Stares at this odd child with a mixture of  compassion and wariness. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob...?

dialogues.speaker: JACOB AND ALICE
dialogues.text: Alice approaches, keeping a little distance between them. Jacob turns.  He's paler now.  Sickly.  As he recognizes  Alice, he looks even a little sadder. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...hello... He goes back to the window.  Alice takes on a tone of  instinctive motherly concern. ALICE (tentative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, you don't look very well.  Are you  feeling all right? JACOB (still at the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been having bad dreams. Alice ponders that. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this where you live, Jacob? He shakes his head no. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just waiting for someone... (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sad about Greta. Alice stares at him, intrigued. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that who you're waiting for? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Alice takes another step forward. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think this is a nice place for  you to be.  Maybe we should go find your  Mom. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't want me around ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...I'm sure that's not true.  I'll bet  she's very worried about you.  I would  be. Jacob turns to her.  His face full of hurt and accusation JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not.  You don't even care about  being a mom.  How come you don't think  about me? ALICE (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said I...wait, what? his lonely eyes begin to well up. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you...I want to stay with you.    Why don't you want me?  Is there  something wrong with me? Alice stares at him, stunned as the realization hits her. She takes a step closer, almost within reach of him. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says I don't like you? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend, with the funny hand. Alice doesn't like the implications of that at all.  She  reaches out to lead Jacob away. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, honey.  We're getting out of  here. But he pulls away, drawn by something in the shadows near stairs. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go now, he wants me again. Jacob scurries up the stairs into the shadows. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Jacob!... She runs after him, charging up the stairs and finding  herself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice climbs up the last stair and steps into the loft.   Looks around, SURPRISED; she's back in reality. Mark sits up in his bed.  Stares at the cuts in hands wit amazement, and dawning realization. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy...shit...he's really real...isn't  he? Mark looks up at Alice, who's more concerned than ever. MARK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing something to my baby.  I know  it -- he's trying to hurt Jacob. Mark looks confused. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Jacob? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My baby! MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you named it already? Alice freezes.  Realizing... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I think he already has a name... Then, she hurriedly begins to gather her things. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get away from here.   Someplace where Krueger can't find him. She bolts for the stairs.  Mark restrains her. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, slow down.  How're you gonna hide  from a guy like that, leave the planet? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! Alice is on the verge of tears.  Mark puts his hands on h shoulders, trying to emotionally steady her. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if you're worried about your baby,  call Yvonne, have the doctor check him  out. Alice nods, getting a hold of herself.  Mark hands her th telephone.  Then grabs his jacket. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to see what else I can find out  about Mr. Fred Krueger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice hurries down the near deserted corridor.  Yvonne ru to keep up beside her.  She looks concerned. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had me scared on the phone.  What's  wrong with the baby? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Krueger's trying to do something  to it. Yvonne suddenly pulls Alice to a halt, dismayed. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Alice...no.  Honey, I love you but  you're going to have to get a hold of  yourself... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark knows I'm not crazy.  Ask him to  show you his hands. Alice starts off again.  Yvonne really looks worried now. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really think you need to calm down now,  okay? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't figure out how he's getting  in when I'm awake... Suddenly a thought strikes her.  She wheels on Yvonne. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do unborn babies dream? Yvonne hesitates, afraid her answer might feed Alice's  fantasies. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...they do, but...do us both a  favor...don't mention any of this to Dr.  Moore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yvonne adjusts the ULTRA SOUND MONITOR.  Dr. Moore finish his pre-examination of Alice.  He is extremely irritated. DR. MOORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Developing fetuses can spend up to  seventy-percent of their day in what we  call dream state.  More as they mature. Yvonne shoots a frustrated look at Alice. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would I be able to sense them? DR. MOORE (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why you're here?  To see if your  baby's having nightmares? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here to find out everything we can,  aren't we? DR. MOORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, I've found nothing about you  that would indicate the necessity of  ultra-sound at this stage of your  pregnancy. Dr. Moore throws a dark look at Yvonne. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to make sure my baby's all  right. Yvonne hands the ultra-sound device to Dr. Moore.  He run the device over Alice's baby.

dialogues.speaker: THE ULTRA-SOUND MONITOR
dialogues.text: The screen comes on with a BLIP.  A barely distinguishabl black and white image appears... DR. MOORE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heart seems strong.  Let's hear it. Yvonne flicks a switch and a steady RHYTHMIC BEAT begins the TRACK, coming from a speaker above the monitor. Alice watches the screen, fascinated.  Suddenly...  The  picture begins to shift and distort with electronic spasm The SOUND of the baby's heartbeat begins to grow LOUDER a SURREAL. Alice turns apprehensively to Yvonne and Dr. Moore, who a oblivious to any of this.  Then... The wall behind Alice starts to PULSATE...become FLESHLIK It ripples blue-red with veins.  Then...a gaping hole ope and we are staring into the fetal canal!

dialogues.speaker: WHOOSH
dialogues.text: Alice is sucked through the opening!

dialogues.speaker: AN IRIDESCENT BEAM OF LIGHT, (ALICE)
dialogues.text: flies through a landscape of pulsing blood vessels and li tissue.  We are inside Alice's body.

dialogues.speaker: AN ENORMOUS VALVE
dialogues.text: stretches open and the beam of "light" shoots through it, then drops down OUT OF FRAME.  Hold a beat. Then Alice floats up INTO FRAME...a translucent figure,  ethereal.  She is caught in a GLOW OF LIGHT.  WE TURN WIT HER to see...

dialogues.speaker: HER UNBORN BABY
dialogues.text: glowing with innocence.  Floating...umbilical chord in th FOREGROUND.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALICE
dialogues.text: as she approaches the child.  She's fascinated...enchante Until she sees something beyond the baby, a face, protrud from the uterine wall.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY KRUEGER
dialogues.text: smiling at Alice. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  See a family resemblance?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: reacts in fear as she sees...

dialogues.speaker: THE UMBILICAL CHORD
dialogues.text: beginning to bulge as something forces its way through it toward her baby.   The bulge moves down the chord, then a second one enters the wall...both "things" travel toward the fetus' belly l golf balls moving through a python.  Then... WHOOSH, WHOOSH, they shoot into the fetus.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE'S
dialogues.text: fear turns to utter horror as she sees...

dialogues.speaker: THE FETUS
dialogues.text: its skin has turned translucent and we see the tiny, "as hideous death" souls of DAN and GRETA in the child's bell

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SOULS
dialogues.text: screaming in terror!

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY'S HUGE FACE
dialogues.text: leering in twisted pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: THE BABY'S FACE
dialogues.text: begins to slowly transform into a mask of fear and pain. eyes begin to flutter.

dialogues.speaker: ON FREDDY
dialogues.text: As he realizes the child is on the verge of awakening.  H grimaces in anger and frustration.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: screams at Freddy. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch him!

dialogues.speaker: THE CHILD
dialogues.text: begins to turn toward Alice as it nears consciousness.  I eyes open, staring in wonder for just a second, then...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: eyes open wide in terror.  She looks around, panicked. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing to my baby?

dialogues.speaker: DR. MOORE
dialogues.text: leans INTO SHOT, removing the testing device. DR. MOORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your baby is perfectly healthy... a  little large for so early on, but as  normal as any I've seen. HOLD ON ALICE.  She's got knowledge Dr. Moore hasn't got. She turns to Yvonne. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's taking their souls...Their spirits  to make the baby...like him. Yvonne shoots a look at Dr. Moore.  She realizes she'd be get Alice out of there before he has her committed.  Yvon moves to Alice. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, sweety.  I'll take you home.   You'll feel better after you get some  real sleep. Yvonne manages to guide Alice from the room.  Dr. Moore  watches them leave.  Then he checks something in Alice's  file.  Picks up the telephone and dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice ENTERS, carrying two mugs of coffee and speaking in frantic rush.  Yvonne follows behind, a look of deep conc on her face. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Dan was there.  Greta, too.  Krueger  killed them!  And now he's feeding them  to Jacob! She hands one of the cups to Yvonne, who tries to get her attention. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice... Yvonne sets her mug down and gently places her hands on  Alice's shoulders, adopting a very reasonable tone. YVONNE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, I want you to stop and listen to  yourself.  Do you know how you sound? Alice nods.  Calmly replies. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely insane.  But I'm not (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you're my friend you'll try to  believe me a little. Yvonne looks into Alice's eyes.  We see that she really c about her, and that Alice is starting to scare her. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am your friend, and I'm worried sick  about you.  But, you're like a locked  safe.  You've gotta start dealing with  reality. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krueger is reality. YVONNE (voice rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so is your baby.  You've got more  than just yourself to think of now! ALICE (getting angry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think I'm doing? (pauses)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  Whether you believe it or not,  Krueger is back.  He's after the baby and  if I don't try to do something about it,  who will?? Suddenly the door is pushed open and Mark enters carrying folder stuffed with xeroxed newspaper clippings.  He look from Alice to Yvonne and back. YVONNE (continuing the discussion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is that you are not doing  yourself or the baby any good by acting  like a crazy woman.  Why don't you take  off - leave Springwood and cool out  somewhere for a while? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Yvonne!  You don't just run  away from this guy!  He finds you in your  dreams. MARK (looking at Yvonne)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sure found a few others before us. Yvonne looks at him with frustration. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, too? MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He invited me to his house last night. Yvonne ruefully shakes her head.  Tries the calm approach YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...we're all tired.  None of us had  any sleep since Friday night... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the only reason you're alive... Yvonne abandons the calm approach.  Wheels on Alice. YVONNE (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's not! She turns for the door.  Mark shoves the folder towards h MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yvonne, look through this stuff.  She's  not crazy! Yvonne knocks the folder from Mark's hand, scattering its contents everywhere.  Then she storms out, slamming the d behind her.  The xeroxed clippings float to the floor.  M glances at Alice. MARK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Alice nods.  They start picking up the scattered clipping ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found out how Krueger's been doing it  while I'm awake.  He's using Jacob's  dreams.  We've got to stop him. Mark looks up at her. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there is...one way. Alice looks up at him, intrigued. MARK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you thought about not having the  baby?  I mean, no baby, no baby's dreams. Alice thinks about it, very hard.  Finally shakes her hea ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't do that, Mark.  He's my last  link with Dan...No, I want him. MARK (nods, smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll find another way.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: leans down again and continues picking up the clippings. One, bearing a photo of Amanda Krueger, lies in FOREGROUN She picks it up, stares at it, pondering. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen her... Her father's voice floats up from downstairs. ALICE'S DAD (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, can you come down a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice comes down the stairs.  Her father is sitting in th living room with Dan's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Jordan. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi... Mrs. Jordan smiles at Alice a little too sweetly.  We see strain of her son's death in her eyes. MRS. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice...Mr. Jordan and I wanted to see  how you were feeling.  Come, sit down. Alice hesitates, this is the last thing she needs right n ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't really a good time.  Maybe if  you could come back... Mrs. Jordan nervously cuts him off. MRS. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, dear, we wondered what you  intend to do with our baby? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I what?  Well, I've thought about  it.  I plan to keep him. Mrs. Jordan glances at her husband.  He uncomfortably shi in his chair, then reluctantly speaks up. MR. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're concerned that this all might be a  little too much for you...I mean, being  single and, well everything... His voice trails off.  His wife frowns at his lack of  fortitude.  She jumps in. MRS. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Mr. Jordan means is that we're aware  of the burden that raising a child would  place you. Alice continues to stare at her, not quite sure where thi going.  Mark quietly appears on the stairs behind her hol the folder of clippings. MRS. JORDAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're offering to help...adopt it and  raise it as though it were -- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I appreciate what you're offering,  but no.  He is my responsibility. MRS. JORDAN (getting adamant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ours.  It's our grandchild. Mr. Jordan, clearly uncomfortable, tries to cut her off. MR. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doris, maybe this wasn't such a good -- She ignores him, getting more forceful. MRS. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your present condition, Alice, we're  worried about your ability -- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  My  "condition"?... Alice's father gives Mrs. Jordan a dark look.  Surprised. MR. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a call from Dr. Moore.  He said  Alice was hysterical.  That she's been  having paranoid delusions and... ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand... MRS. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know you've been through a lot but  there's more than your feelings at stake  here. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not taking my baby! Mrs. Jordan stands, losing her composure. MRS. JORDAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courts may not agree with you. Alice's father stands.  Turns an angry gaze on Mrs. Jorda ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do.  I've heard enough of this  crap.  You think you can just walk into  my house and start threatening my  daughter?

dialogues.speaker: SWIRLING JACUZZI
dialogues.text: As Yvonne approaches.  She steps up to the side and ginge stretches out her foot to test the water.

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE OF WATER
dialogues.text: frothing and bubbling ominously.  Yvonne's toe glides dow INTO FRAME, hovers, then dips into the swirling white wat

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: smiling happily.

dialogues.speaker: SURFACE OF JACUZZI
dialogues.text: as Yvonne lowers herself into the luxurious water.  We're sure any second something is going to rise up and eat  her...But nothing happens...yet.  She sinks in up to her  neck, purring like a kitten.  Her eye lids grow heavy.  S to slide closed.  She quickly opens them.  Starts to rise up...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: No one in sight.  Yvonne ENTERS, wet from the jacuzzi.   Tosses her towel on a chair and heads for the high dive.

dialogues.speaker: THE LADDER
dialogues.text: Yvonne climbs INTO SHOT, going up the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BOARD
dialogues.text: She stretches, then starts walking out on the board.  Wat shimmers in the pool thirty feet below her.

dialogues.speaker: OVER YVONNE'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: as she moves out onto the board.  CAMERA TRACKS DOWN leve with the back of her head.

dialogues.speaker: THE END OF THE BOARD
dialogues.text: from below, looking back and up at Yvonne as the board  strangely begins to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: reacting as the trembling increases.

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTIRE BOARD
dialogues.text: begins to shake violently, whipping back and forth.  Yvon fights to keep her balance.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: reaches for the rail.  It comes off in her hand!

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING OVER YVONNE'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: at the end of the board.  Rust runs back from the end lik wave breaking on the shore.  Then the board begins to spl and crack, forming into four pieces.  Freddy's claws!

dialogues.speaker: THE BOARD, (SIDE ANGLE)
dialogues.text: The claws at the end of the board begin to roll up and mo toward Yvonne.  She steps back.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING OVER YVONNE'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: as she retreats from the approaching claws.  Suddenly, a  jagged "thumb", formed from the rear of the board, rolls SHOT, trapping her.  She is literally in the palm of Fred hand!

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY'S CLAW
dialogues.text: rolling up around Yvonne.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY'S CLAW
dialogues.text: Holding a terrified Yvonne in its palm, and about to clos over her.  She has only a second to act.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: leaps from the claw.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: as she moves down THROUGH FRAME, tumbling out of control.

dialogues.speaker: THE POOL
dialogues.text: about seventy-feet below and getting closer every second CAMERA races for it!

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: she begins to regain her equilibrium.  Straightens out,  starts moving into a diving position.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: Now in perfect diving form, she gracefully slices through air like a knife...

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE'S FACE
dialogues.text: suddenly filling with horror.  She SCREAMS as she sees

dialogues.speaker: THE POOL
dialogues.text: which was FULL a second ago, is now EMPTY, save for a sma puddle in the center.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOTTOM OF THE POOL
dialogues.text: Yvonne hits the puddle!  Water splashes up and...she keep going, right through the concrete!

dialogues.speaker: BLACK LIMBO
dialogues.text: suddenly Yvonne breaks through the void in a crash of  shattering glass.  Fragments and shards SPARKLE and GLIMM as she plummets past CAMERA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small room with rusted and decaying lockers along the  walls, like something forgotten in an ancient gym.  The  entire floor is a NIGHTMARE JACUZZI, churning with BLOOD! Eerie red light, coming from beneath the swirling surface plays over the crusted walls.  Suddenly... Yvonne dives down INTO SHOT, plunges through the surface the BOILING BLOOD then disappears!

dialogues.speaker: GRAINY B
dialogues.text: Frozen in time.  Staring from her nun's habit, eyes fille with infinite sadness and despair.  She's standing on the grounds of the asylum, its tower looming behind her. ALICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think I'm nuts. MARK (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's their problem. The photo is yanked down out of frame, WHIP PAN to Alice  looking up from the photo towards Mark, across the room. are in Mark's loft.  He's scanning one of the copied  newspaper articles. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's our problem, Mark.  If I don't  deal with this, they really might try to  take Jacob. (she looks at the photo again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said she committed suicide? MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what the newspapers thought.  She  spent the rest of her life in the asylum.   After Krueger's trial she flipped out and  hung herself, so they thought. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning? Mark shakes his head, grinning at the creepiness of it. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They couldn't prove it.  No body!  Nuns  bumping themselves off is bad for  business. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I've seen her grave. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty plot.  Memorial stone.  Vacant.   They never did put her under.  Cool, huh? He hands her the clipping.  Alice scans it.  We see the  obituary with the headline: A VICTIM OF THE EVIL WITHIN U ALL. SPECIAL TOMBSTONE TO MEMORIALIZE NUN. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor woman... MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit. Alice puts down the article.  Glances at Mark who has gon over to a shelf of books, searching through them for a  particular volume. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. MARK (still hunting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She killed herself.  Her soul's gonna be  in torment. Alice frowns, this is news to her. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you hear that? Mark finds what he's looking for.  A huge volume with a  crumbling leather cover.  He pulls it out and sets it on drawing table with a THUD. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here...somewhere. Alice looks down at the book.  It's RLA Frakes' EARLY  CHRISTIAN MYTHOLOGY.  Mark opens it.  Moves his desk lamp closer.  Thumbs for a page.  Finds it.  Reads. MARK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transmigration.  Soul of the sinner.   Yeah, trapped in it's earthly resting  place. (grins at Alice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pictures are totally cool. Alice gives him a frown, then goes back to Amanda's photo the nun and the asylum tower. ALICE (thinking out loud)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dream...she was trying to stop  him...she started to tell me how, then  the door slammed. (thinks, then realizes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must have done it.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTO
dialogues.text: Following Alice's gaze, CAMERA PANS UP from Amanda's face the ASYLUM TOWER behind her.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: pondering the tower. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no other way.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE AND MARK
dialogues.text: She puts down the photo and faces Mark. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to stay awake and watch me.   Okay? MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem...what are you going to do? PUSH IN on Alice's face. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to find out how to deal with  this guy for once and for all. Alice turns and steps out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: still perusing the volume, his back to Alice.  Suddenly,  FREDDY'S CLAW shoots out from the DESK LAMP and SLAMS the book closed!

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: jumps, stunned.  He blinks, did that really happen?  Then grabs his mug of coffee and takes a long drink.

dialogues.speaker: PUSH FOCUS FULL SCREEN
dialogues.text: to drawing of Mark's comic book creation, THE PHANTOM  PROWLER.  Suddenly... A HUGE HAND holding a PENCIL comes INTO FRAME, and contin the sketch.  SLOWLY TILT UP TO

dialogues.speaker: MARK'S TIRED FACE
dialogues.text: filled with an artist's concentration.  He glances OFF  SCREEN, and CAMERA slowly follows his gaze to

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: asleep in his bed.  TRACK IN CLOSE on her face until the wall behind her becomes the corridor in the asylum.  She  opens her eyes and sits up.  CAMERA FOLLOWS HER as she st and moves down the corridor. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda! Alice moves down the corridor, away from CAMERA, searchin for Amanda.  Comes to a corner.  Turns down it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a spread of PHANTOM PROWLER sketches lying on th floor.  CAMERA TRACKS across them, following a TRAIL OF  SKETCHES that lead to the far side of the room where we f Mark, lying on the floor at the base of a rack of comic l shelves, propped up on one elbow, bored, flicking through another comic. TRACK AROUND MARK to reveal Alice still asleep on the bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, arched, Gothic corridor, lit by pools of light. the far end, we see a staircase, silhouetted by a  rainspattered window behind it.  The stairs lead up into shadows. ALICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda!  I need to talk to you! ALICE walks past CAMERA INTO SHOT and pauses.  Sees the  staircase, starts hurrying for it.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: Alice glances toward the top.  Instead of leading to a  doorway, the stairs dead-end against a BRICK WALL.  She  climbs the stairs to the bricked up doorway at the top. Laying her head on the wall, pressing her hands to it, sh murmurs. ALICE (cont'd) (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found you! Suddenly, from behind... FREDDY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin', piglet? Alice turns toward the voice. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party's just starting.

dialogues.speaker: ON ALICE
dialogues.text: She starts rolling across the wall.  As we pull back, the camera turns on it's axis to reveal that Freddy has adjus things.  The set is now tilted on a different axis Alice rolling away from the camera, down the staircase, but on wall, not the stairs. Suddenly, a RUSTING METAL DOOR is revealed in the wall do which she rolls.  She rolls into it and crash lands in th nightmare jacuzzi room. Freddy slowly rises from the boiling jacuzzi, until he st on the surface of the pool, grinning smugly. Alice climbs to her feet, warily.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: plunges his arm beneath the surface and yanks Yvonne up b the hair!  She sputters and chokes, gasping for air.  Fre laughs... FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I found.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: is taken by surprise.  Steels herself.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: Alice glances toward the top.  Instead of leading to a  doorway, the stairs dead-end against a BRICK WALL.  She  climbs the stairs to the bricked up doorway at the top. Laying her head on the wall, pressing her hands to it, sh murmurs... ALICE (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found you! Suddenly, a door slams.  Alice, startled, looks.  But bef she can react, she is swept off her feet. Alice starts rolling across the wall.  As we pull back, t camera turns on it's axis to reveal that Freddy has adjus things.  The set is now tilted on a different axis and Al is rolling away from the camera, down the staircase, but the wall, not the stairs. Suddenly, a RUSTING METAL DOOR is revealed in the wall do which she rolls.  She rolls into it and into the bloody  jacuzzi room.  She grabs a hanging chain, but can't hang She drops into the murky water.  She slowly turns with ut distaste. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you goin', piglet?  The party's  just starting. Alice, startled, quickly regains her composure. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know exactly what you're up to,  Krueger! FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, Alice, I thought I was up  to...Yvonne! He plunges his arm beneath the surface and yanks Yvonne u the hair.  She sputters and chokes, gasping for air.  Fre laughs.  Alice is taken by surprise.  She steels herself. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go. Freddy cackles and dunks Yvonne savagely. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going once.  Going twice.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY AND YVONNE
dialogues.text: he hoists her closer, until their faces are an inch apart he licks Yvonne's cheek.  She doesn't know whether to scr or throw up.  Then Freddy slowly runs a CLAW across her  breasts, leaving a thin trail of blood. Alice circles Freddy until she is on the opposite side fr Yvonne. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the A, the L , the i,c,e.  We're  three together... Yvonne's eyes swivel to Alice in recognition.  As Alice  speaks, she grabs a jacuzzi/pool instrument (a skimmer, a harpoon-shaped window hook)... ALICE AND YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the way it's gonna be! and as they speak, she flails Freddy across the stomach,  while Yvonne executes a backflip (as previously seen in h diving sequence) out of Freddy's grasp and on to dry land Freddy staggers back and disappears into the jacuzzi. Alice and Yvonne run back into the asylum and SLAM the do behind them on the now empty jacuzzi. We cut back inside the jacuzzi to see Freddy's hand emerg and pull under his still-bobbing hat.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE AND ALICE
dialogues.text: sprawled on the corridor floor where they landed.  Yvonne turns to Alice, they throw their arms around each other. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? YVONNE (nods, collecting herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...So that's him.  And you're not  crazy. Alice and Yvonne share a weary, rueful smile.  Alice pull Yvonne to her feet. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to find Amanda.  She's the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark lays on the floor, still propped up on one elbow,  reading the comic.  Bored, he pushes it away.  Notices on nearby which he hasn't seen before.  Pulls it over

dialogues.speaker: THE COMIC'S COVER
dialogues.text: has something very familiar on it...Freddy's claw, in mid scratch, as though it were tearing the cover open.  Writt across the top in dripping letters is the title: NIGHTMAR YOUR STREET.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: intrigued, rolls hover on his stomach and opens the comic with both hands.  His expression changes as he sees

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COMIC
dialogues.text: drawn in black and white, a comic book style representati of Greta's death sequence!

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: begins to flip back through the comic book.  INTERCUT his horrified reactions with

dialogues.speaker: THE COMIC BOOK
dialogues.text: the B&W illustrations depict the other mayhem that Freddy already caused.  Dan's death and Yvonne's dive. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shitty son of a bitch! There is a drawing of him, lying on the floor, reading a  comic book.  The drawing is followed by several BLANK FRA

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: stares a moment, touches the first empty frame, then he T A LINE DRAWING and begins to UNRAVEL into the COMIC BOOK!

dialogues.speaker: BLACK AND WHITE
dialogues.text: a whirlwind of black and white comics swirl round and rou slowly abating to reveal

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: in COLOR, backed against a wall of BLACK AND WHITE Freddy scaffolding.  (Mark will be the only thing in color  throughout the sequence.)  He looks around, amazed. PULL BACK to reveal he's standing in a corner made by two walls of scaffolding.  They tower above him, rusting,  decrepit, held together at odd angles -- a nightmarish cr between Mark's comic-stuffed racks and the ones in his  father's workshop. Mark looks around, frightened.  Starts climbing his way u and out.  Freezes when he hears...RIP! Mark looks through the scaffolding and sees

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: on the other side, ripping through the scaffolding suppor as though they were made of paper, cutting his way to Mar FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to cut another character out of the  story!

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: eyes going wide.  He jumps down.  Turns around.  Sees the towering walls of scaffolding stretching ahead of him to  seeming infinity.  He races away.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: running away from CAMERA down an enormous CANYON OF  FREDDYIZED RACKS.

dialogues.speaker: THE CANYON OF RACKS
dialogues.text: Looking down from far above we see Mark frantically racin through the canyon.  Freddy steps into the canyon behind Long shadows stretch out before them.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: slides to a halt as he comes face to face with A DEAD END No way out.  He turns as he hears FREDDY'S CACKLE.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK AND WHITE FREDDY
dialogues.text: laughs as he reaches out and grabs the scaffolding on eit side of him.  His fingers and claws plunge through the pa racks.  Freddy cackles with laughter, then starts racing a missile toward Mark!

dialogues.speaker: BLACK AND WHITE FREDDY
dialogues.text: TRACKING with Freddy as he rushes down the aisle, riding SKATEBOARD, ripping and tearing through the rack supports

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: at the dead end.  CAMERA RACES right toward him!  He rais his arms against the impending collision.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH MARK'S HANDS
dialogues.text: as we see BLACK AND WHITE FREDDY's leering face loom righ into CAMERA about to CRASH right into MARK!  Then

dialogues.speaker: ON MARK
dialogues.text: Freddy's gone!  Mark lowers his arms, amazed and relieved But his relief evaporates as CAMERA QUICKLY TRACKS AROUND we see the scaffolding begin to collapse from the far end the canyon forward, falling like dominoes toward us

dialogues.speaker: ON MARK
dialogues.text: as ton after ton of scaffolding and shelves crash down ar him, trapping him at the dead end corner.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: looks at all the destruction around him.  Suddenly, SPLAT Something red drips onto him from above.  He looks up.

dialogues.text: The shelves that were stuffed with comics a second ago ha become a WALL OF DOLLS; everything from BARBIES to RAGGED ANNS. Then, about halfway up, B&W FREDDY steps into view, dragg a GRETA DOLL IN A HIGH CHAIR with him.  (They are the sam size as the other dolls around them.) Greta's porcelain face and stomach bear large cracks, thr which an evil, soupy, RED goop oozes out.  She stares  imploringly at Mark.  Speaks through cracked lips. GRETA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mark...help me...!

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: stares up at her, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY AND GRETA
dialogues.text: Freddy teasingly scoops his clawed finger into Greta's to Lovingly licks her red goop off the end of his claw. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she delicious or am I crazy?  Try a  bite. He laughs.  Then gives her a shove.  The high chair tilts forward, then topples off the scaffolding.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: screams in frustration and rage. MARK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MARK'S SNEAKERS
dialogues.text: as they step back OUT OF SHOT.  Greta, now a tiny porcela doll, smashes to the floor, exploding into fragments.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: stares down at the shattered fragments of tiny Greta.   Outrage begins to crawl across his features.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK AND WHITE FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: ON MARK'S BACK
dialogues.text: shaking with anger and rage.  Freddy drops down into the  foreground behind him.  Chortles smugly as he raises his  claws for the kill. Suddenly, Mark whirls around, and as he does he is no lon Mark, but

dialogues.speaker: THE PHANTOM PROWLER, (IN COLOR)
dialogues.text: MARK (cont'd)

dialogues.text: Payback time, you scarfaced limpdick. He glares menacingly at Freddy as he raises two FUTURISTI PISTOLS.  Aims point blank into Krueger's chest and start blasting away!

dialogues.speaker: BLACK AND WHITE FREDDY
dialogues.text: eyes open in wide surprise.  Wads of CONFETTI fly out of holes being hammered into him.  The impact knocks Freddy the ground.

dialogues.speaker: PHANTOM PROWLER
dialogues.text: Gun smoking, he advances on Black and White Freddy who li unmoving in FOREGROUND.  Suddenly...WHOOSH!

dialogues.speaker: BLACK AND WHITE FREDDY
dialogues.text: leaps to his feet!  He is now transformed into SUPER FRED a bulked up, rippling muscle Freddy Krueger.  He stands w his hands on his hips, like a comic book hero. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster than a bastard maniac!

dialogues.speaker: THE PHANTOM PROWLER
dialogues.text: quickly raises his gun again.  FIRES! FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More powerful than a loco madman...it's - laughs as bullets bounce off him. FREDDY (cont'd) (poses)

dialogues.speaker: ME
dialogues.text: Then he whips his clawed hand up, swiping out toward CAME

dialogues.speaker: MARK'S BACK
dialogues.text: as Freddy's claws RIP and TEAR through it.  The tears wid and grow until we are looking right through him at...  Freddy's hideous face! PULL BACK to reveal the now PAPER Mark.  As Freddy contin to slash him to shreds, the COLOR begins to DRAIN OUT of and RUN ONTO THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: MOVE THROUGH A SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: of Black and White Freddy cutting Mark to shreds.  His mo open in SOUNDLESS SCREAMS. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told ya comic books were bad for ya.

dialogues.speaker: FLUTTERING PIECES OF PAPER
dialogues.text: fill the air.  They float down.  FOLLOW THEM as they move together towards the open comic book on the floor of Mark room.

dialogues.speaker: COMIC BOOK

PULL BACK from the comic and we see Mark lying on the flo next to it, CRUSHED TO DEATH beneath a section of his  collapsed shelving.  The COLOR that drained from the PHAN PROWLER is now a growing pool of Mark's own blood. CAMERA CONTINUES TO PULL BACK and we see the rest of his is unharmed, except for a single set of shelves near Mark that teeter dangerously. In the BACKGROUND, Alice lies on the bed still sleeping. as we continue back, we see that Mark's room is now part the Asylum corridor.  We can hear Alice's voice, speaking Yvonne OFF SCREEN. ALICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dream, she was standing in a room. CONTINUE PULLING BACK as Alice's VOICE grows LOUDER. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: ALICE AND YVONNE
dialogues.text: standing in FOREGROUND in the corridor.  We see the back Alice's head as she looks at Yvonne.  Before she can answ the CRASH of Mark's teetering bookshelves cause them to t back toward the scene of the carnage.  Mark's lifeless bo lies beneath all the scaffolding.  Alice clutches her bel in pain. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.text: Alice sees herself on the bed in Mark's room.  Alice on t bed becomes awake.  At that moment, both she and Yvonne  VANISH from the corridor, yanked out of the dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yvonne's eyes snap OPEN as she comes awake with a start. quickly glances around, realizes where she is, then hurri rises from the water

dialogues.text: Police cars are parked out in front, their twirling light strobing the scene RED and BLUE as a small crowd of onloo gather to watch Mark, in body bag, being wheeled into a  waiting coroner's van.

dialogues.text: emerge from the big commercial door.  He has his arm arou her, nodding to plain clothes cop who follows them out. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing in the room was up to code.  It's  a miracle you both weren't killed. Alice's red-rimmed eyes flash with momentary anger.  She  realizes something. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he won't hurt me.  He needs me alive. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Alice just shakes her head, knowing he wouldn't understan COP (cont'd) (to Alice's father)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her home.  She probably needs some  rest. The cop turns away.  Alice's father nods, starts leading toward the street.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: as Yvonne's car rapidly pulls to the curb.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: sees her.  Shrugs free of her father's arm and runs towar the street ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yvonne!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE AND YVONNE
dialogues.text: ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what Krueger's doing.  Every time  someone dies, he gets closer to  finishing! YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob.  We've got to get to Amanda before  it's too late. Alice leads Yvonne back to her car.  They start to climb

dialogues.text: Yvonne jumps behind the wheel.  Alice gets into the passe side, her door still open.  Beyond it, we see her father  approaching. YVONNE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how are we gonna -- ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to go to the asylum and find  her body.  Mark said her soul's trapped  with it -- that's why she can't come to  me.  It must be! ALICE'S DAD (approaching)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE AND HER FATHER
dialogues.text: ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. ALICE'S DAD (adamant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I won't have you running around in  the middle of the night.  You're coming  home. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Dad -- ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now. Alice reluctantly nods.  Turns to Yvonne. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Amanda.  And hurry. Alice's father pulls her from Yvonne's car.  HOLD ON Yvon BEAT, watching her go.  Then she starts the engine.  Slam the car into gear with determined purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and her father ENTER.  She's frustrated and angry. gives her a stern paternal look. ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I want you to go upstairs and get  some sleep. Alice thinks.  Then nods, suddenly giving in. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  That's exactly what I need  to do. Her father is taken aback.  He grins. ALICE'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is... Alice kisses him on the cheek, then heads for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the STEPS in FOREGROUND.  HEADLIGHTS sweep over them revealing that they are overgrown with weeds and cluttere with trash.

dialogues.speaker: GARGOYLE
dialogues.text: its face smashed and eroded by years of neglect and  vandalism.  TRACK LEFT to see Yvonne's car at the bottom the steps.  Yvonne closes the trunk, then starts up the  steps, TOWARD CAMERA, carrying a flashlight and some tool

dialogues.text: boarded up.  Yvonne steps INTO SHOT, pausing before them. She looks up at something high above her.

dialogues.text: rising high into the first rays of dawn.  The paling sky reflected in the three windows at the top.

dialogues.speaker: YVONNE
dialogues.text: stares at it, realizing something.  She turns back to the doors and climbs in through a gap in the boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Early morning light flows in through the windows,  illuminating the corridor, revealing years of neglect.   GRAFFITI adorns the peeling walls.  LEAVES and BROKEN BOT are strewn across the floor, even a few empty cardboard  BOXES, the makeshift homes of transients, rest among the  clutter. YVONNE walks INTO SHOT, TOWARD CAMERA, shining her flashl around, moving cautiously until she passes CAMERA and we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dream version of the corridor.  Alice walks PAST CAME INTO SHOT.  She shouts for Freddy. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on out, Krueger!  The game's over.   I know what you're up to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she wears a look of grim determination as she taunts Fred ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was too strong for you.  So you picked  on Jacob, you bastard!

dialogues.text: Alice comes around the corner, stalking INTO SHOT.  She l around for Krueger, shouting as she heads for the STAIRS THE TOWER ROOM at the end of the corridor. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to tailor make him so you  can live through his dreams for the rest  of his life. Alice halts.  Glares around the walls and doors. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I won't let you!  You hear me,  Krueger! Nothing.  Alice starts up the stairs that lead to the bri wall.  ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you won't talk to me, maybe you'd like  to talk to Amanda.

dialogues.text: Alice stands before the wall.  Lays both her hands agains the bricks. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda! (louder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Amanda Krueger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yvonne stands at the top of the stairs facing the same br wall in the real asylum.  She hefts a pick, and SWINGS AT BRICKS.  There is a LOUD THUNK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE TOP OF THE STAIRS.  The THUNK echoes eerily, as th from a long way off.  Suddenly we hear Freddy's CRY OF RA from OFF SCREEN.  Alice whips around!

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: charging toward her down the corridor.  Flashes of LIGHT  (BANG!) kick him further along, CLOSER TO CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: rushes down the stairs, and runs toward the next corridor front of her.  Charges around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: she charges toward the open metal door to the room of ONE HUNDRED MANIACS.  Their insane moans drift out into the  corridor.  Alice throws a taunt back to Freddy. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on you fucking coward!

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: races around the same corner.  Alice is no longer there.  Freddy slides to a halt as he recognizes the doorway that leads to the HUNDRED MANIACS.  Their MOANS rise, growing  LOUDER as Freddy stands before the gaping doorway transfi by fear.  He doesn't hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA rushes towards Freddy's backside.  We hear the SOU of SQUEAKING, RUSTY WHEELS.  Then a VOICE building to a h pitched SCREAM!

dialogues.text: screams as she charges toward Freddy with the black, nast FREDDY STROLLER.  She hits him from behind!

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: SCREAMS as he's impaled on SPIKES protruding from the fro of the stroller!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR TO THE MANIACS

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY AND STROLLER
dialogues.text: fly through the open doorway.  Bounce against the rial at top of the landing.

dialogues.speaker: OVER ALICE'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: as Freddy FLIES down the stairs, separating from the  stroller.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY
dialogues.text: tumbles TOWARD CAMERA, screaming!

dialogues.speaker: BOTTOM OF STAIRS
dialogues.text: Freddy looks around in horror as his fathers surround him literally begin to tear him to pieces.  Freddy SCREAMS! ALICE gazes down in victory. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: closes her eyes, relieved, but not really wanting to see  this.  As Freddy's O.S. screams recede, HOLD ON ALICE Suddenly, one of the striped spiders drops onto Alice's c from above.  She screams and jumps back, as others land a begin scuttling up her sleeves.  With a scream of revulsi she tears off her jacket and begins stamping on it. JACOB (O.S.)

dialogues.text: Mommy, meet my friend... Alice turns and looks back through the doorway to see

dialogues.text: Now an Escheresque, expressionistic landscape.  A puzzle  world made up of bits of Freddy's boiler room, the asylum corridors and TOWER, the Elm Street house interior, the  abandoned church, etc.  It's an insane, logic-defying wor where water runs uphill and stairs and doors stand at  impossible angles to one another.  Across everything,  Freddy's boiler, on a huge PENDULUM, swings back and fort counting cadence.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB AND FREDDY
dialogues.text: stand in a far doorway before a flight of stairs.  Freddy been transformed.  He and Jacob now both have the same  ETHEREAL GLOW.  Freddy grins, sardonically. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what I really needed.  Thank you.   It's a whole new me.  Like it?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: dread rising inside her, leaves the asylum and steps into Escherland.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOILER PENDULUM
dialogues.text: swings across CAMERA, WIPING FRAME to

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY AND JACOB
dialogues.text: He takes Jacob's hand.  Laughs, savoring the irony. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid's got my profile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yvonne swings again with the pick, knocking another brick loose.  Through the holes that she's made we can see the  rotting boards on a door.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: as she steps through the door and moves into the maze.   CAMERA follows her, then stops as Alice moves past.  PAN Alice as she looks up at Freddy and her son.  Jacob looks apprehensive. JACOB

dialogues.text: Mommy...? ALICE

dialogues.text: Come on downstairs.  He won't hurt you.   He needs us both. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which half would you like? ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jacob.  Time to go home.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOILER PENDULUM
dialogues.text: arcs across FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY AND JACOB
dialogues.text: Jacob looks up at him.  Hesitates.  Then RUNS DOWN THE ST toward CAMERA.  Freddy quickly turns and charges UP THE  STAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: ESCHER MAZE
dialogues.text: Alice is a small figure near her door in the BACKGROUND. Jacob races toward her, away from CAMERA.  Freddy, upside down, rushes across TOP OF FRAME, trying to head Jacob of

dialogues.text: running toward CAMERA.  Suddenly, Freddy pops INTO FRAME, upside down, right behind him!

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Terrified.  Running toward us for all he's worth!  CAMERA TILTS UP to Freddy taking a swipe at him with his CLAWS!

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (CRAVE-INN)
dialogues.text: He's almost to his mother when...he hears an OFF SCREEN v that stops him in his tracks VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back of Alice's head in FOREGROUND watching as Jacob turn and looks back at Dan!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (ESCHER MAZE)
dialogues.text: Her eyes open wide.  The man she loves, the man she thoug she'd never see again, is right before her.  We see the  confusion and longing in her face... ALICE (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan?...

dialogues.speaker: DAN, (CRAVE-INN)
dialogues.text: wearing a warm, reassuring smile as he moves toward CAMER DAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Jacob... Come to Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking up as Dan WALKS ACROSS THE LENS toward Jacob, his arms outstretched to the boy.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: Hesitating.  Unsure.  Dan ENTERS FRAME.  His hand moving  toward Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: She fights back confusion and realizes ALICE (shouting)
